text: Love that it is hidden away from the other ramen houses on spring mountain. Food is tasty,  I like the shoyu broth but have also enjoyed miso. My son loves the curry,  has good flavor just no potatoes with it.  Doesn't stop him from ordering it everytime. Prices are great, doesn't hurt your pocket.  Atmosphere is nice and cozy,  small like other ramen spots but never crowded when we come so not stuffy.

My sushi chef at Ojah recommended this place over sora or monta, so trying both we figured why not.  And I have to say this place combined the best of both worlds.  Not to mention they have cool war time Asahi beer ads from Japan, just saying they're kind of cool.

Best Katsu Curry and excellent service in town!!!

Delicious curry.
Server so attentive and great friendly staff.
My #1 place when craving Ramen or a Japanese dish.

Consistently great! Hubby, son, and I walked in on Monday afternoon (Happy hour time) and we were welcomed with "Thank you for coming!" Our lovely server lady brought a set of toddler utensils and a bowl then took our beverage order. White House wine, Asahi ($3 each) and left us to peruse the menu. I always order the same yummy ramen. (Tonkatsu ramen with egg and bean sprout.) Hubby orders spicy ramen. A side of rice and happy hour karaage for our son. Attentive service, yummy food... It's our one and only place for ramen.

Love this place! Good variety and price, and they serve karaage and takoyaki! Always good service, delicious ramen and every time I've come here there is no wait, which is a HUGE plus cause I don't like to wait when I want my ramen fix!
Hands down, very tasty ramen. Good broth and ofcourse friendly staff. They have Asahi draft too:)

it was my first time there but the rice kamiche was good love the place and energy
happy people will definitely go back and try other food on the menu. Keep up the good work.
This place is amazing and the service is always great! I like it better than shin-sen-gumi in Los Angeles, now my second favorite ramen spot.
Service was great, the food was delicious, the environment was very inviting, relaxing and comfortable. Jazz music playing, the tone of other in the bistro was happy, laughter and smiles.  Love it.

As a tonkotsu ramen aficionado, I'm constantly on the lookout for the next great ramen-ya, especially one that can rival the best in LA, or dare to dream, the ones in Hakata, Fukuoka, Japan. It was with great excitement that I noticed their preopening announcement, and we set out to try them for a weekend lunch. Upon entering the restaurant, we noted a clean Spartan aesthetic but the wooden benches were quite hard and mildly uncomfortable. The menu was simple and straightforward. We asked the waitress what the Tatsu ramen was, and she explained it is their tonkotsu with additional chashu (6 vs 2 pieces). We went ahead and ordered the tonkotsu ($7.77) and Tatsu ($10.77) ramen. Our bowls came out quickly and were accompanied by seaweed, ginger, a tiny bit of green onion and sesame, but no egg. Surprisingly, there didn't seem to be an option to add an egg, or other accompaniments, i.e. additional green onion, corn, etc. Interestingly, the shio and shoyu versions appear to come with an egg though.

While it looked promising initially with the proper thin white ramen noodles, our experience was underwhelming. First off, the noodles were overcooked and not al dente or firm enough. While the amount of noodles was adequate, the amount of broth was on the skimpy side and could have been served hotter. (Usually the better ramen joints serve their broth piping hot so that it is still plenty warm by the time you're finishing your meal.) The porky flavor and richness of the broth was ok but not something you would want to slurp up every last drop of. The chashu was not quite tender enough, a bit too fatty (that I was compelled to pick off the fatty parts), and somewhat bland at the same time. It was also odd that when I asked for shichimi togarashi (Japanese chili powder and a classic condiment), they only had chili oil available.

In the end, Ramen Tatsu was just okay for us. It is better than much of the local competition, but doesn't induce any cravings to return.

Of all the ramen places in LV, this is my favorite. They serve ramen just like you can find in most places in Japan.  Soup taste and the noodle firmness is just right.  Nothing fancy or unique about it but my wife and I both love Tatsu for the soup taste and their noodle.
Everytime the ramen is cooked right.

My second choice is Misoya Tomi for very unique and tasty miso ramens and third will be Yagyu (really at home taste for most Japanese, just make sure you order the noodle firm so they don't over cook).
This place is an authentic traditional Japanese ramen shop. I suggest the tonkatsu and the karaage appetizer.

This is by far the BEST ramen restaurant in Las Vegas. I have been to Monta and Sora Ramen and they cannot compare to Ramen Tatsu... Amazing service and they treat you like family here. Their spicy miso is the best I have ever had. I come here at least twice a month to get my ramen fix. Thank you Ramen Tatsu!

Stopped by here twice and wasn't necessarily wowed. The first time I ordered tonkotsu ramen and bf ordered spicy miso ramen. While he enjoyed his meal, I thought mine had much to be desired. The chashu was a bit chewy, tough, and lacked flavor, and while the tonkotsu broth appeared creamy, it didn't really taste rich. It was somewhat reminiscent of Anime Ramen's tonkotsu and thats no compliment. The thin noodles and egg were fine, nothing bad to say.

The second time we visited, we both ordered plain miso ramen. The broth was very tangy and tasted rather thin. The thicker curlier noodles served with it were harder (not cooked long enough?) than I would've enjoyed. The chashu, again, was disappointing. 

The service was good - it was just two waiters standing towards the back and watching the second anyone needed anything, seeing as how they recently opened, so I feel a bit bad giving them three stars. I think they'll get steady business regardless, however, since they're in a strip mall that also has that karaoke place and Cue D's.

Been to many Ramen places. In town, and out of town (travel for work) and I gotta say that I love this place! 
When I lived in CA I would travel from the Bay Area to Sacramento for Shoki House (their first location), and sometimes to New Tokyo Ramen in Marina, but Ramen Tatsu is awesome. So happy this place is local for me. 
I heard about a few other ramen places in town that people rave about, but the wait times were long, service below average and the ramen tasted like it was quickly prepared and lacked anything that made it stand out. 
Ramen Tatsu takes care of you. 

Friendly staff. 
Been here 5 times now and will continue to come. I don't think they've remembered me yet but each time they're kind, attentive and generous. This place has even given us some of their iced green tea to take home and catered to our 'not a lot of time but really wanted ramen' needs when we needed to rush an order. They rushed it right through by serving two cups of our tea, the check right after food and our second order of noodle right on time while still keeping is from feeling like we were being a bother or like we were just a quick dollar for them. 

Great food. 
Again, top notch ramen in Vegas.
Maybe the 'other' ramen joint that people rave about (starts with an M;) was great in the past, but the last few times I've gone it's been average/good, not great and definitely not as good as Ramen Tatsu.

I've narrowed my go-to bowl as the Shoyu with an extra egg and extra noodle mid way through. My girlfriend enjoys the Spicy Tonkotsu with an egg. It's definitely spicy. Two scoops of hers on my Shoyu change things up enough for me. 
She's had to extra spicy miso too, but enjoys the Tonkotsu more so. 

Price is awesome. We both eat for less than $30 and that includes extra noodles, extra eggs, edemame, two iced green teas (these are delicious), and green tea mochi ice cream. All on top of our two bowls of ramen. 

All in all, I rank it up their for Ramen joints.
I'll be back, many....many more times.

Thank You fellow Yelpers for directing us to this place.  We got into Vegas and just wanted something yummy, but not heavy. This placed nailed it. Awesome ramen dishes. Ended up ordering Japanese curry w/ rice to share. For desserts: Strawberry Mochi ice cream and Yuzu sorbet. Iced green mocha was refreshing. *Thumbs Up* 

Service was impeccable. Friendly and helpful wait staff.  If we lived there, we would be regulars. LOL

Cheers!
Boooooom savory ramen! I'm biased because I love noodle soups, but the broth and ingredients inside were so delicious! Wasn't a huge fan of the appetizers, but I'm sure there are some good ones!
This place has some of the best ramen in town! The staff is always friendly, their fried rice is amazing, and the curry ramen is an absolute must. A favorite date night spot for sure.

Small japanese restaurant with great food and service, the ramen is prepared quickly and is very delicious they also offer lots
Of toppings for your choice of ramen.

Ramen Tatsu is a worthy competition to Monta Ramen, with no lines of waiting customers. The soup base of the Tonkatsu ramen was so packed with flavor it was almost creamy. The gyoza tasted just like Monta. The Shoyu ramen was another winner. Although I prefer the Pork chasu at Monta, Ramen Tatsu presented a thicker cut of chasu that was also full of good flavor, just slightly different from Monta.  They also have a few dessert items like NY cheesecake, mango cheesecake, ice cream and Mochi ice cream. 

Friendly and prompt service from Emy made the meal a pleasant and relaxing experience. No hurrying to finish my meal to make room for waiting customers. The size of the restaurant was slightly bigger than Monta. Give this place a try, it would be worth your time.

The fried rice in this restaurant is very tasty, love it and highly recommend it.    I also ordered a tonkotsu ramen, the broth is rich and the ramen is perfectly cooked,   but the pork is not tender enough.

Really enjoy the ramen there. Very friendly staff.
We ordered the deluxe and Tsekemen ramen. Very happy to try the dipping noodles for the first time. Although I'm not sure if I prefer the traditional bowl of noodles over Tsekemen, it's quiet nice to complete my ramen experience. 
Deluxe is definitely the best ramen we ve ever had. Very mild yet flavorful broth with ridiculously amount of toppings. Go with a empty stomach and it ll definitely satisfy you.
Well kept secret. Never had a wait and they have kimchi and a reverse osmosis filter on their tap water. So good!
I really liked this place. Little hole in the wall Japanese Ramon place. Great for lunch and there Ramon is perfect very delicious!

First time coming here and I loved it! The ramen was delicious and the service was excellent! Our waitress was so fast and precise with everything. The spicy miso ramen was perfect. The regular tonkotsu ramen was very tasty and the sliced pork was tender and delicious.
I love this place. along with all of my family and friends. this is our go to place. Love the music. Love the vibe. its so nicely decorated as well. the owners are awesome! love ramen tatsu!
Amazing server. She was the greatest. Ramen was delicious. Fried rice was amazing! Definitely coming back.
Great service... Good authentic Japanese ramen... Right price for food... Would recommend to friends...

Great Ramen Place... I tried Spicy Ramen for my linch and it was really good.. also tried Karaage which was tender.. their Pork Belly was okay.. it could be much better if there was some meat instead of just fat.. But it was okay... Also there are many Japanese Miniatures around the store.. Love them...

First time to try eating at this ramen house and all I can say is... Definitely worth it! The food were amazing and delicious.. Me and my boyfriend ordered Deluxe Ramen with Spicy Miso soup, Fried rice, Seared Chasiu, Tonkatsu, and Gyoza.. Everything was pretty good and our bill for the night was night bad at all..
The soup just too salty.    When I complained to the server about that.   They said if u wanna add some soup   U gonna pay $1.50.  WTF.  NEVER COME BACK

This place was a bit small but the ramen was fantastic. Definitely recommend the Shoyu, and the Miso (the spicy miso is FUEGO, too hot). But what really made this place incredible was the service. Our Server/Host was so genuinely sweet and welcoming! She's the only one for the small restaurant and happy to serve everybody with a smile and in a timely manner. A++ for her amazing hospitality!! Would definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

Short: Decent food, good prices, but didn't leave me super happy.

The long:

Have been meaning to hit this place for a while after seeing pretty good reviews. Arrived and was greeted warmly and told to sit anywhere. The place is littered with their "Happy Hour" special and a ad to add extra noodles. Otherwise the place is rather bland for a ramen shop; can't complain. 

I was hungry, so I ordered the Deluxe ramen which has extra chashu (roasted pork slices), cabbage, bean sprouts, eggs, and corn on top of the normal toppings. Shoyu (soy sauce) broth with thinker noodles. Then I ordered a serving of karaage and (a surprise!) takoyaki. For $3 on happy hour for the sides, I wasn't expecting the amount of food I'd get for the sides; the karaage was a meal on its own with the chicken and side salad, and the takoyaki was small but had enough of them to feel worth it. Both were fine, not amazing. I've had better karaage at Fukumimi ramen. and better takoyaki at festivals, but not bad for the price.

As for the ramen: It's the worse I've had. I'm grading it against Monta and Sora ramen, so it's not terrible, but just doesn't make me rave. The broth isn't very complex and lacks punch. The chashu, while there was a lot, isn't very flavorful. The rest of the toppings on the ramen were simple and easy to add, but they didn't make this bowl feel like a "Deluxe" special from a ramen shop, more so a hodgepodge of toppings on decent ramen. 

In the end, I left this place stuffed and content, but not very happy. The service is good, the prices are decent (Happy hour sides are great), the food is just lacking in overall flavor and depth. 

I'll try this place again, but I suggest either Monta, Sora, Fukumimi, or Misoya Tomi ramen first.

Ok tried to eat at monta five times this past week and the lines and the wait times were very long.  Tatsu ramen is now my go to ramen joint and can always get seated.   Well, until everyone else finds out how good this place is.   Definitely the ambience is much nicer since you don't have to look at people staring at you waiting for tables to open up.   They also offer excellent Gyoza and curry too.

Stuffed! Had Ramen Tonkutsu with the most perfectly hard boiled egg, fried rice, gyoza.  Place seems to have the right balance in most of their dishes. Love they they have kimchee on the menu. Even so everything seems to be hard core japanese, kimchee and Ramen is just a brilliant combo. noodles perfectly cooled and paired. They use different noodle thickness for different soups as I discovered tonight.

My first time at Tatsu, we had Gyoza, miso ramen and spicy Tonkotsu ramen. Everything was amazing!!! Especially cha-shu pork ( of course hose made!), it's melt in your mouth. Miso ramen was so tasty, it is hard to find really good miso ramen. I have tried so many miso ramen because it's my favorite :) but they usually tasted like miso soup, or no flavor... Miso ramen at Tatsu is very flavorful, if you like authentic Japanese ramen, you must try Tatsu!
I also loved their Maneki-Neko collection. They are so cute!!!

This is one of my favorite ramen places. I love it. It's usually always quiet and empty when I go.

However, my last experience wasn't too too great. My mushroom, and my chashu was cold. I had to soak it in my broth to warm up. 

I went during their happy hour, so I was able to get $3 karage. It did come after my ramen. I guess they had to fry it so it took longer. 

The service was pretty great, but I'm the type of person that likes piping hot food, so the cold items turned me off.

This is our favorite ramen stop in Vegas.  Hearty thick broth, no insane lines, and the waitress we always have couldn't be any more sweet or pleasant.  We just discovered a new fave drink, too.  Iced green tea - no sweetener but great green tea taste.

One of the Best Ramen house , have a good vibe with customer which give us a reason to be there evrytime we decide to have good Ramen with an authentic japanese restaurant, and  good way of how they treat customers that really makes their food extra special. You zjould try the ka rage which is one of the best too. Good food tastes a lot better with nice friends people to spend time and treat evryone a friend

I love trying all the new ramen places that are opening up around town, but this place was disappointing. Got the Miso Ramen, the broth lacked flavor and the charsiu was cold. It would've been one thing if it was just my bowl, but my friend's charsiu was cold too. It's clear that they cooked the charsiu before they opened and added it into the ramen after the broth was poured into the bowl. I may come back to try the appetizers and rice dishes, but I don't think I'll come back for the ramen. If you like thick noodles, try Ramen Sora instead.

Very nice and kind waiter. Decent ramen at a reasonable price. Short wait, no line. Kimchi fried rice is delicious and since there is not many people it's pretty quiet. A nice place to hang out and eat lunch with friends, or by yourself if you prefer

Don't know why this place only has a 3.5 stars. It deserves way better rating than 3.5. I was skeptical to go here as first since I'm a big fan of Monta and Sora. And after trying the fusion ramen place, which was a pretty big disappointment, I thought I should just stay with what I know and go with the popular places. But after reading one reviewer's detailed description on how true the owner is on ingredient and style at the place, I figured I'd give it a try. 

And now I think I don't ever have to go to Monta anymore, especially Monta is pretty much a guarantee to stand in line kind of place.  It's a cute little place run by real Japanese folks. The Japanese lady who took our order is so cute and attentive. If you check in on yelp you can get a free drink, ice green tea included. 

They have many variety of ramens, just like other ramen places. The pork is perfect in between Monta and Sora. I always think the pork at sora is too big and fatty, and pork at Monta is too thin and a bit stingy. Pork here is perfect size and they have regular size noodles and thin noodles, just depends on what type of ramen you get. And their egg is perfectly cooked. The yoke is to perfection. 

Their karaage is THE BEST I've ever had. Meaty, perfect crispness without too much breading and not oily at all.  You must order it when you go. 

I really don't need to go stand in line at Monta for my ramen fix anymore!!

I usually come in and order the Tonkotsu Shoyo made extra spicy with garlic chips added into it.  I love that combo since there is a very decent level of the spice (I am a spice-holic) that melds so well with the garlic chips.  I keep meaning to go and try out the other ramen there, but it's too difficult for me to deviate from it!
This is probably my favorite ramen places in Las Vegas. The food is the absolute best outside of Japan in my opinion.

I'm pretty satisfied with Ramen Tatsu.  Good crispy and flavorful gyozas.  I've had the shoyu ramen and the spicy miso, I've also tried (a spoonful) of the Tonkotsu and Shio.  My favorite was the shoyu, the flavor was there, more subtle not salty.  Noodles are al dente and according to one of the waiters they are fresh made daily some place in California.  If we are to compare to the other Vegas notorious ramen place, I feel Monta's broth has become too diluted and salty for me. But Ramen Tatsu does feel a lot like Monta, if fact the chef seems to be the old one from Monta.  The cut of pork is thicker here and less marbled fat which I like.  Good, very friendly service.  Pleasant space to sit down and enjoy dinner, maybe not so much the style of a fast food bustling traditional Japanese ramen, but I like enjoying my beers while I eat and I don't mind this lack of authenticity.  Also a plus, there's never much of a wait here, but it's a new place.  I'll be coming back to Ramen Tatsu for my ramen fix.
Well worth the drive from Henderson. !!!   Leaving with a full belly and a full wallet ! Great value and taste

I ordered the Shoyu ramen. It was delicious.   The noodle texture was just right. It was very clean inside the restaurant. The server had good customer service. I liked the atmosphere and design inside the restaurant. The only thing I really wanted was to have a bit more noodles in my ramen without having to pay extra. Overall a great experience.

I had the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen.  It was ok, but I do prefer the ramen over at Ramen Sora.  The broth at Sora is tastier and the meat quality is better.  However, the service was great and it may be easier for you to find a parking spot at Tatsu because of all the other shops and restaurants around.  The restaurant is pretty small but I went on a Saturday afternoon and there were still a couple of tables free.  Overall, Ramen Tatsu is good but I probably would not come back because I like Ramen Sora   much better.

My wife(Japanese)  wanted to get some ramen and we remembered a review in the
newspaper. We decided to give the Ramen Tatsu a try. It is a very simple restaurant and the workers were Japanese. We were very happy to find the ramen was excellent and the price was right. I had the curry and my wife had the special. The broth was rich, the pork tender, and the noodles cooked correctly. We will be back.
First time here, loved it the service very good very accommodating. We will be eating here again. We had the miso ramen and fried rice loved it.

Way better than Monta Ramen! Broth was good, egg was perferctly creamy at the center, and chashu was yummy. The only thing I do not like is the chopped cabbage they put into the bowl! Minus the cabbage, it would be perfect. Did I mention the portion was huge for the Deluxe bowl? Yes, huge.
Best ramen in town even if I had a stomach ache at one time I ate here. I'd go back just because the ramen is next to authentic!

4.5 stars so underselling this place.
Only Vegas Veterans know about this spot.
Sensai so well known we're not allowed to mention his name.
Signature broth cooked for hours with pork head, cuts are pork shoulder not belly...details, baby! 
With our favorite Thai place remodeling, it's a no brainer where we're going.
Great service and food is very good! I had the spicy Tonkatsu and the broth is very good. Also make sure to get the chicken nuggets (Karaugae?) I would highly recommend this place.

Ramen Tatsu is not my first restaurant pick when I crave for ramen, but when all the other ramen restaurants have a one to two hour wait, this is my go to place.

Depending on what you order, your ramen will come with different toppings. I like the miso ramen because it has corn on it, which not a common thing to find in ramen at other restaurants. If you have the taste buds for extremely spicy foods, my family loves the EXTRA spicy miso ramen. My family likes to compete to see who can handle it the best :P They also have the Chashu Rice Bowls or Fried Rice that is really tasty and good for anyone who doesn't feel like eating ramen.

The staff is friendly, food comes out quick, food is good, and the setting is cute.

Craving ramen and did not have any desire to sit outside and wait so came back here.  The food has always been most excellent but seems to have increased a couple notches.  I had Shoyu with garlic chips and spicy bean sprouts.  Simply put...yum.  My bride had miso with an extra egg.  For her, serving size was slightly larger then tummy capacity.  Maybe we should have not started with the perfectly cooked gyoza.  Great service...ramen served pipping hot.  Condiments on table ready, full, and clean.  A perfect ramen fix!

This place really is the only consistent ramen joint in town. I like that you know what you'll get before ordering.  Staff remains excellent despite the uptick in business. Chef/Owner, Wayne, obviously cares about the quality of his food. 

The karaage is still very tasty, but there may have been a slight change to the batter. It's a little lighter than the previous version, which I preferred, but it is still a very, very good and well-seasoned karaage.

My family still includes Tatsu in our weekly restaurant rounds.

Ramen Tatsu is the best you can get. Period. The staff is friendly and on point. The food is amazing!! I personally prefer the Extra Spicy Miso, as that is my favorite! But the Spicy tonkatsu is my second favorite (I love it hot) :) either one will have you sleeping in the booth. I feel like this ramen is made with love and soul. I know it sounds corny, but they take great pride in their work. I've become a regular here and so have many of my friends and family. Plus I'm from Hawaii. Ramen and Saimin is something all of us know. Try it, you won't regret it.

P.S. Order one to go, you're gonna want it later. Pro tip.

-2soup Midgley

My first foray into ramen and I am very impressed. Must do this again soon to try out rest of the menu. Had the tonkatsu shoyu ramen, the broth was very rich and flavorful as was the pork slices. You won't be disappointed.

Delish, similar to more traditional Japanese Ramen. The price was on point less than $25 for 2 people. 

I had the Tonkatsu Curry. It was so filling. Wish I lived in the area so I could enjoy this meal more often. 

Waitress was so happy and friendly! Couldn't ask for better service
We have been here a few times & it always satisfy our cravings for ramen. The chasiu bowl is one of my fave. Fast & friendly service.
Consistently excellent ramen with great service- highly recommend. All for the right price.

I just went there yesterday with my boyfriend, it was our second visit. We both ordered TONKATSU SHOYU with thick noodles. Personally I'm not a fan of thin noodles,so the thick noodles were perfect for me (mind that as far as asian noodles go, the THICK NOODLE is on the thin-medium to medium range).  It doesn't come with many ingredients but that's what I love about it, simple and delicious. You can always side order additional toppings of your choice. The broth is dense and full of flavor, though it might be a bit salty. The meat was cooked right, I enjoyed my ramen with a carefully selected and prepared chasiu :)

The decor of the restaurant is very nice, simple and not flashy. I got to have my dinner in the slow flow of jazz, I can imagine myself bringing my laptop and books here to work, but that would be inappropriate lol. Overall, I love this restaurant, very relaxed environment.

Ordered shoyu (medium spicy) ramen, karage, beef bowl, gyoza, and the veggie ramen. OMG, this is the best ramen I've had! The charsiu melts in your mouth, as did the beef in the beef bowl. We got the matcha iced tea as well, and it was a very mild but lovely flavor. Definitely recommend if you're a ramen fan!
Ok this little hidden gem has great Ramen!!!  They also have Japanese Curry and Curry Ramen!  The prices are good and the food is excellent!

If you know what an authentic Japanese Style Ramen is, this is THE place to go. 
I'm from Japan, I know how the ramen-ya (restaurant) should be.
Even my friends who were visiting from Japan approved  their Tonkotsu soup. It is authentically flavorful!

You know some Tonkotsu soup is very smelly and taste some kind of weird bitter flavor if you came across a ramen cooked by cooks who don't know the real Tonkotsu flavor. 
Ramen soup is NOT built a day.

Certain trainings are required, enormous days and hours you have to spend to be a real Ramen cook.
The owner must be a hard worker, and you will feel their prides and spirits in one bowl of noodles and soup. 

Try their "Real" Ramen!

I'm a newbie to ramen but I'm quickly getting addicted.

Due to Cafe de Cebu's continuous bad service... I went across the street to this little gem and got friendly service (thank you for helping me with the choices) I went with a basic shoyu ramen even though the nice waitress recommended the Tonkotsu and after I posted some nice photos my Asian friend scolded me - I was supposed to order the Tsukemen as it's the best! I'm sorry, "it's the bomb!"

Well I enjoyed my meal so much I'm returning to try the other dishes!

Amazing!!! I have been a long time "monta" patron and I think I have found a formidable contender. The soup was sooooooo good the miso is bomb! More choices for toppings, inexpensive for the quality and the broth was cleaner and leaner. Not so fatty... Plus the service was outstanding! The darling server brought out my little baby of 20 months his own bowl and baby utensils.. 
So good, I'll be back very very soon.

You walk in and you are greeted by the strong sodium scent and fresh noodles. I waited less than a minute to be seated in the bar. My server was really pleasant and she was attentive to all my needs. I got the pork belly ramen and I thought it was too salty. I've tried other ramen places before and this one didn't really stand out to me. Maybe my taste buds don't really find salty soup appetizing. I personally prefer the beef broth in pho. I also got the chicken karange (I'm pretty sure that's not how you spell it) and I thought it was just alright - I've had better ones before. Why I'm giving this place 4 stars is simply because of my server. She did an amazing job. She was wearing the best accessory anyone could have - her extremely contagious smile. She was like that with all her customers which obviously made up for my salty food. If you prefer ramen over pho, then I'm sure you'll enjoy this Japanese Restaurant.

I ordered the spicy miso ramen w/ egg, which was amazingly delicious!! The Asian female server was super friendly and efficient. :) My hubby ordered the small curry rice, gyoza & chicken Karaage. The only reason why I didn't rate this place the perfect five stars was because my piece of the chicken Karaage had a chunk of fat in it - EWWWW!!

This restaurant has average ramen. The broth is flavorful, the noodles have a good bite to them, and the chasiu is tender. But overall, there was nothing memorable about the ramen. The restaurant is small and the staff is friendly though, which is a plus in my book. 

If you are near the area, this is a good place to get your Ramen fix if you are really craving it!
This place is awesome. Great flavors and great people. Prices are on point. Their spicy ramen is a definite go to. We always frequent this place when we are in Vegas.
Kind of cheesy on the inside. And Ramen is very bland. Karrage chicken appetizer was not good. Gave them 3 tries, just no flavor....... :o

Came here with two friends at around 11:30AM on a Friday when it opened. Place was fairly full, but we got a booth seat with no wait. 

Service: (4 star) never nothing special but food came out quickly.

Tonkatsu shoyu ramen: (3.5 stars) above average but nothing special. Came with 2 pieces of chasu. 
-Added a soft boiled egg to my ramen. Doesn't come with one but you can add it for a small extra fee.

Kaarage: (4.5 stars) crispy and fried well. Thought this was probably my favorite dish during the meal.

Deluxe (3.5 stars): this was the same as the tonkatsu shoyu but come with more chasu and an egg as well as the other condiments. 

Would probably come here again but didn't blow me away.
Their soup is the best! Service is wonderful! Good pricing and not crowded at all

We came here because I received an email from Yelp recommending this place. We usually go to Monta and was pleasantly surprised with Tatsu. There's more menu choices than Monta and the restaurant is bigger. We ordered takoyaki (octopus balls -- 5 pieces $4.77) and it was absolutely yummy. I had the deluxe ramen and my husband had the curry ramen. Both ramen bowls were delicious. We're definitely coming back!

Great stuff! I am a huge Monta fan, but haven't been able to get in lately. Plus, I like that Tatsu is more quiet and well, it's possible to get a table. The chasiu isn't quite as melt-in-your-mouth as it is at Monta, but it's still fantastic. Service can be a bit slow as is often the case in small restaurants. We weren't able to get our appetizer before the ramen so we cancelled it. Will definitely be back -- lovely place.

After my first time here it became my new favorite spot. The food is great plus they have a variety of options outside of their ramen selection.  Their happy hour is from 3-6pm and you can get so much food starting at $3 (not including ramen).  

All the servers I've had the past few times I've been here have been all very friendly!! I love how it's not as crowded as other ramen joints. Oh! And they serve Tsukumen. It's a Japanese noodle dish that I haven't found served anywhere else in Las Vegas (correct me if I'm wrong, really, I love Tsukumen). That's originally why I came here.

Food is good... Price is good.... 
Portion is good...
If you want to have large bowl, you can choose deluxe....

One of the best ramen bowls I've ever had. We came shortly after the lunch hour so we didn't have to wait and got seated immediately. The restaurant was cool in the hot summer sun. I'm thankful for great service who gave us our drinks immediately. The ramen was broth was extremely flavorful and delicious. The noodles were chewy and soft.

Spicy Miso - yummmmm.

Spicy Tonkostso - yummmmmm.

Excellent ramen ... this isn't your college 5 for a dollar ramen ........  this is your good Vegas ramen.
Had the Tonkatsu ramen, with 2 eggs and garlic chips. The garlic chips are a must have topping! Would recommend coming back

Decent-enough ramenya on the outskirts of Chinatown- broth isn't as fatty as other places, which may appeal to others who feel that Sora et al are too rich for their tastes.

Went in with my BF and split the deluxe tonkotsu-shoyu, the house specialty per Tetsuro. Deluxe bowl comes decked out with all of the extra veggies and meat: four slices of chashu, nori, an egg, green onion, sprouts, corn, cabbage, and bamboo shoots. Also added on orders of edamame, karaage, and lychee sorbet.

Broth was understated but still had good depth, and the various toppings and giant bowl made it a more than generous portion for two, well-priced at just under $11. Egg was a little overcooked, which is  a ramen pet peeve of mine and I also didn't care for the corn or overwhelming amount of cabbage. 

Karaage was moist and I really enjoyed the light breading. Squeezed some lemon over it for an extra perk of acidity.  Sorbet was a great palate cleanser with a pop of flavor, larger portion than what is given gratis at Ramen Misoya Tomi. 

Wouldn't put this in my top ramen picks for Vegas, but wouldn't turn down a visit if a friend suggested it, either.

One of the best ramen places I have been to hands down.  They make the noodles fresh right in front of you.  If you love spicy they can make you cry,  if you love mild you will delight in sumptuous and quality food and service.

Okay peeps. I don't usually write many reviews, but... this place is the bomb. At first my daughter and I was unsure about the other reviews because we were not sure if mainlanders idea of ramen is the same as HAWAII people's ideas. 

Well let me tell you HAWAII people and all people with taste buds, this place is ONO!  So if you from our beautiful islands, you can rest assured this is a great place to get ramen (saimin).   Don't forget to get charsu cause it is one of the best charsu that I've eaten in all of my life. And that's saying a lot as I don't really care for pork. The outside has a little crisp and the jelly like heat reduced fat. Ummm. Sound like an oxymoron to say it wasn't oily fat, just ono. 

Go try them. Gaurantee it's going to be one of your favs and easy on the wallet too!
Yummy! Much better compared to Ichi Ramen. Small intimate restaurant. Worth the drive.

I love eating Japanese ramen noodles no matter what time of year it is. Sure, that goes for any delicious soup out there, but some of my friends think I'm weird eating hot soup on a hot summer day. I went to a place once and they only serve ramen during the winter season - Boo!

My favorite broth here is their tonkotsu infused with shoyu. Love this savory and somewhat creamy broth without being too salty. What a wonderful option that I am able to choose thin or thick noodles with my soup. They give you good portions of noodles unlike other places that skimp on it. Depending on the soup you order, it comes with basic toppings and add ons are extra charge.

I'm not sure if I come here because of their soup or because they have one tasty fried rice and chicken karage that pair well together. I love the condiments on the table which add flavor to the chicken karage as a dipping sauce. 

The service here is always excellent even when it's usually one gal working solo in the dining area. The older lady is my favorite server. She's cute and always has positive energy when she's serving my table. I love how this place is so warm and inviting! I like seeing the wall decor they put up and the dark wood throughout adds warmth. 

This place also has a family friendly atmosphere compared to other ramen joints where lots of hipsters hang out and therefore tends to be noisy. This place is smaller than the other ramen joints around the valley. That's another reason why I like to dine here giving it a more personal space while I slurp my savory bowl of goodness.

Decided to give this place a try after a friend recommended it. Had a girls lunch, ordered seared chasiu, gyoza, spicy tonkatsu ramen and kimchi fried rice. I'm not really a fan of spicy food, but my friends are and they said that the soup was really spicy but edible so be wary. Better to have it regular and add your own level of spice. Overall price was adequate for quality and amount of food. Everything was served hot and fresh. The service was provided by the owner herself, she was friendly and quick to refill drinks and check in on us. We came during the happy hour special which starts at 3pm. It wasn't too busy, which made it a perfect spot for my girls and I to chat. The environment was clean and open. 

Definitely recommend and will return.

We got the Takoyaki which is octopus balls from Japan, glad to have finally tried it here in Las Vegas, The Ramen is good what I like about the menu is that it indicates the Noodle as thick or thin. What I want to come back for is the Tsukumen. Will give another update.
Great ramen, cute place and fun/relaxed atmosphere! Vegetarian ramen was excellent :)
Ramen Tatsu is a great place. Great food and staff. Small place but definitely cant go wrong. Will be coming back soon.

Hacía mucho frío y tenía ganas de una sopa caliente llegamos a este lugar y fue el paraíso para mí. Pedimos saber la sugerencia y escogimos un ramen con puerco con un poco de picante. 
El servicio fue bueno y rápido.
Los postres son pequeños pero deliciosos. 
Muy buen lugar!
I'm a big fan of monta and i think this place has a bigger portion however it cost more. I love coming during happy hour gyozas and karage are so good

Do they have Tsukemen? Is it good? Are other items good too?

Yes, Yes and Yes.

Tatsu is totally underrated. They deserve way better rating than 3.5 - thus 5 stars to help bump up the rating.

To me, Tatsu comes close to Monta, Sora and Fukumimi (and Shoku, for that matter), if not better. And so far, tsukemen (with authentic, special thick noodle!) is only available at Tatsu (except Hiromaru but don't count).

If you haven't, try the deluxe ramen - it's a tasting menu for their ramen. Also, fried rice and gyoza are pretty good too.

If you tried a long ago before the ownership fuss, give them a second chance.

My wife has more unforgiving tastes than myself (looking at you, Guy Savoy), but she approves Tatsu too. Consider this review two votes.

We want good restaurants to stay.
Came here on a Monday night since it is close to the Rio and World Series of Poker. It was pretty crowded at 5:20 and so we sat at the bar. Good prices and good food.

Awesome place for ramen. The spicy shoyu is my favorite. Great customer service short wait for your food. I have brought different groups of friends here and most agree that the food is very authentic and delicious. Will be back again and again and again.
Sooooooo good! Bf brought me here the service was awesome.. I did add my own raw jalapeños once we got home but I know to get extra spicy next time
Best place for Ramen in Vegas!  Such a cute place and very authentic. Food is amazing. Service is great-she is so sweet!  Will come back again and again!
This is one of the best ramen joint in Vegas. They have all kind of ramen and all of them are great. The charsiu bowl is great for kids. Definitely recommended for people that love Japanese ramen.
Delicious! Big portions. I liked my tonakasu bowl. My sister got the spicy miso, which way too spicy to enjoy. Our server was crazy nice and funny. They also have HH. I think its better than monta.

Came here a few nights ago since we knew Jinya and Monta had long wait times. This place surprisingly had long wait times too (my boyfriend and I waited around 40 minutes here) but we thought we should try somewhere new instead of our usual ramen spots.

My biggest gripe is that this place does not like to do any accommodations for customers. When we sat down , we wanted to order tonkastu ramen but the waitress told us they have been out of it which was kinda inconvenient , they should have put a sign on their door that said they're out of it since it's a popular menu choice & we waited so long to get tonkatsu ramen in mind. I asked the waitress if I can switch out the tonkatsu broth w/ miso broth instead and she said no but I can order their miso ramen. My issue w/ ordering their miso ramen is that it has corn and bean sprouts in it which makes the broth taste terrible (mainly just the bean sprouts w/ my experience at Fukumimi) & I just cared about getting pork, mushrooms and broth I like for my ramen. I asked if it's possible to switch out the corn and bean sprouts for different toppings. At first the waitress said no they can't do that but she can just remove those two toppings (and I will still be paying same price). She also suggested that I could order the shio or shoyu ramen since those don't have corn or bean sprouts in it like the miso ramen. However , I prefer heavier broths like tonkatsu or miso. I showed her on their menu the toppings I wanted to be substituted is pretty much almost the same price as corn and bean sprouts so she finally she agreed to doing my order after I asked and mentioned that twice.

Food came out quick which was the only good thing for waiting so long. All the toppings were really cold. I tried some of my boyfriend's shoyu which didn't taste good at all , thankfully their miso wasn't bad. So glad I didn't go w/ waitress' recommendation to order shoyu. Other ramen places have chili paste or spice seasonings on the table available but this place charges you extra.

Came here on date night on a Wednesday night around 8pm, there was no one in here and we were sat immediately. The server was extremely nice and brought us some water and sapparos immediately. We ordered the miso ramen with medium spice and added garlic chips. This is HANDS DOWN the best ramen I have ever had in the Vegas area. The noodles were perfect, not too hard or soft and the perfect thickness. The broth was so extremely flavorful, and the added garlic and spice made it even more amazing. I have never actually finished an entire bowl of ramen before, and I ate everything, including the broth. We also got some strawberry mochi ice cream, which was the cherry on top. Will most definitely be returning as soon as possible!

As a Japanese ramen fanatic, I'd have to say I was pretty disappointed with their tsukemen. 

Broth wasn't thick and flavorful... If you cook and reduce the broth with the bones you would get more flavor, but it seems like they've just added more salt..

The noodles were broken and too hard. Tsukemen noodles should be soft, chewy and long. With the thickness of the broth and the texture of the noodles, the broth should really stick unto the noodle when consuming.

If you're ever in LA, go to Tsujita Annex and you'll know exactly what I'm talking about. 

Just go with the miso ramen at this spot.. Or just go to LA.. Haha 

Not one star because their Asahi was super refreshing :)

Might be my new go to ramen place. Favors are comparable to the other big name ramen joints in town. I like selection of cooked foods they have. Kimchi fried rice is a plus. Try the curry ramen if you're looking for something new. Haven't tried the shio or Miso but the tonkotsu is good.

In my quest to try every Ramen place off the strip I stopped in here for lunch. Ordered my traditional Tonkatsu Ramen with extra Chashu and an egg. Broth was nice and smooth. Chashu soft and melt in your mouth. The egg was cooked to a perfect soft boil. The noodles tasted fresh. Great place to go since Monta is so packed at peak times.
Great food, excellent service, small place good for having lunch however crowded always, try to go after 1:00 pm to find a table and car parking. Definitely will keep going there.

This is great ramen.  I was there at around 9:00 pm on a weeknight, and it was not busy, which was good for me, but understandably not great for business.  I am just so tired of waiting forever for Monta, and I'm not the biggest fan of Sora, and Fukumimi was a little too far for me that day.  Anyways, next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be sure to go there instead of Monta.  I had the tonkotsu.  The soup was perfect, the chashu was amazing, and the egg was perfectly done.  I seriously had no complaints.  I've eaten tonkotsu ramen in Hakata, Japan when I lived there for two years, and Ramen Tatsu took me back.  Prices were very reasonable too.  Check this place out!

Wife and I love this place. Monta and Jinya are good choices as well, but this place has got tsukamen, which is my go to. Each time we've gone, we've had great experiences. Ramen is on point, service is awesome, and we always enjoy the music.

Been coming here on and off for a year and i have not had a bad experience. If you love ramen and other types of Japanese cuisine, I highly recommend this restaurant. I have tried most of their ramen but my favorite is the spicy Miso. I would also recommend their takoyaki! It is the best i had so far!

Real good ramen. Ordered the tonkotsu shoyu- it was delicious. Takoyaki was really good as well. Overall, good food & great service although the place is quite small. Will definitely be back for my ramen fix.

Giving 4 stars because every single time I've been here it was never really busy so I always was guaranteed to sit and get my food fast. Plus the service here is really good they tend to you right away and my food comes out pretty fast. The ramen though I'd have to say kinda reminds me of the ramen in Hawaii (yum) the broth isn't too salty and the noodles are soft so I'd have to say the food here is good enough. I love ordering the spicy miso tho with the extra spiciness and an extra egg. The portions are enough to fill you up so its good. The atmosphere and the inside looks well decorated and they play good music here hahaha they even have desserts too! But I haven't tried any of the desserts here. This place is worth a try it's authentic Japanese noodles (:

This stuff is good, guys. Super good ramen with that comfort food feel!

Ramen Tatsu is located in one of the busiest strip malls on Jones and Spring Mountain alongside other notable restaurants and businesses. Parking is usually very busy, so be on the lookout!

After getting situated, you'll find Ramen Tatsu tucked away at the north end of the plaza. Once inside, you are met with a quaint space with proper and kitschy Japanese decor. 

The menu is easy to follow. And the food is great. I usually go with the Tonkatsu Ramen with a side of their chicken karaage. Also, beware! Their spicy levels are no joke... definitely not for the faint of heart. I love anything and everything spicy, but their special habanero peppers are no joke.

Food/Cost:
We usually stop by the Asian BBQ restaurant next door but since it was closed for vacation we decided to come here. I'm glad we did! The Ramen were full of flavors where you know they have been boiling that pork bone for a long time! That was makes a true Ramen and not bland and make it up with lots of salt and MSG etc. Cost was very descent compared to many generic Ramen places. For the taste and flavors in this place, its more worth paying a little bit more anyway for the amount of time it takes to make the soup taste that way. The portion of kimchi fried rice we ordered was a bit small for the price we paid. Flavor was good but nothing to rave about. Has a bit of sour flavor too due to the Kimchi which was meh. Will think twice before ordering that again though. I would just stick with the Ramen. Haven't tried the other stuff though. 

Service:
The one and only lady I see working works like a champ! The place is small but enough capacity where I think it will really help to have 2 people. She took orders, brought your food, refill waters without you even asking and get your check. Even with all that by herself, she was still quick at her service. Wow! It wasn't until toward the end, we saw another lady walked out to help. I hope she was just taking a little break because otherwise, the heck you will leave a partner in chaos by herself?

Ambiance:
Cute little place with the generic Japanese theme. Not much decor but enough to get the idea your at a Japanese restaurant. Place is clean and AC was good enough to bring the mood to eat hot soupy Ramen at 105F outside!

If you like SPICY ramen this is the place to be! The flavor in the spicy miso ramen is intense and the chili is made with habanero which gives it intense heat! Don't get the double extra spicy(dangerous level) like me or you might not be able to finish it! ..and I love spicy! Also, the spicy miso ramen came with ground pork which I thought was odd so on my second visit I asked to replace it with chaisu instead! Mmmm. Make sure to check in for a free soft drink! Enjoy!
Excellent ramen! Very flavorful broth. It's way tastier than Ramen Monta. Awesome service too.  I will be back for sure.

If you know ramen then just skip this place. The ramen was average, the takoyaki and gyoza were both frozen variety and the paking lot is a hassle to get in and out of. 

The service was good but it was also slow.
Great Ramen, every time I come they are consistent with the flavor of their food.  Great service by the woman (don't know her name) but she has an amazing bubbly personality.  Nice happy hour menu.
excellent service, really friendly staff. the establishment itself is much nicer than some of the other ramen places I've been to in vegas. the 'deluxe ramen' and 'katsu curry' were very good.

One of the best ramen restaurant in this town. I've tried so many other ramen restaurants in the town but this is the best!
Tastes not salty at all. 

The women was really friendly. I am so appreciate her services. 
When we visit this restaurant,there was happyhour. We ordered takoyaki on the side. 
I can smell the flours of takoyaki in other restaurant and I hate that. But this restaurants takoyaki was bomb! So tasty:)! 
 
I will visit this restaurant whenever I craving delicious ramen! 
But wish you guys open more late..!!

So this by far is the best ramen I have (even better than Jinya.) The waitress was so kind and the atmosphere was so nice and welcoming. It was not crowded I came in around 1 pm. I ordered a spicy ramen w/ goyza , which I have to say was perfectly cooked ! Nobody ever cooks the goyza right but this place hands down is the best & you get to make your own goyza sauce which is entertaining as you wait for your food . The pricing is fair and not so expensive ! I should have went during their happy hour. But seriously I wish I could of left a bigger tip . Great place & excellent food ! Great service !

Came in here to try tsukemen for the first time with K.O. Saw a episode of mind of a chef where David Chang goes to Japan to each a lot of ramen and tsukemen being one of them. 

So when we got in we noticed tsukemen wasn't anywhere on the menu. The waitress told us that when they received the noodles for the tsukemen it was the wrong kind and will be another month of so till they the new noodles. Not sure what rake so long to get different noodles. 

So we decided to just try the regular ramen and it was full of disappointment. May have been the worst ramen I had. 

We ordered the smoked chasu to share and I got the Tonkatsu shoyu ramen with garlic chip and egg add-ons. 

Smoked chasu was very flavorful and delicious. Meat quality was decent and the spicy sauce and the garlic on the side was a nice addition. Now on to the ramen. 

The broth - very light, kind of bland, and had a weird aftertaste. 

Noodles -  wasn't bad, wasn't great. I prefer the thinner noodles for Tonkatsu shoyu normally but decided to try it with thick since that is what they normally serve with this ramen

Chasu - the chasu in the ramen is of worse quality than the smoked chasu. It is probably some of the worst chasu I have had in ramen. Just looking at it you can tell the meat is of subpar quality. 

Garlic chips - I liked the crunchiness of the chips, but seemed a little overcooked to me. 

Service was good though and the workers were very friendly and that's the reason for the 2 stars.

A small restaurant in the heart of Chinatown - Ramen Tatsu is a great place to get your ramen/Japanese food fix.  I had the fried chicken (I know, I know - but I don't actually like Ramen) & a bowl of steamed rice, which was awesome!  My husband is a ramen-fanatic and he loved every bite.  He said it was a close second to the ramen he had in Tokyo!

Not only was the food great, the service was even better.  They were so super sweet to us and didn't rush us out when we were clearly finished eating.  If you are looking for a ramen spot in Chinatown - check out Ramen Tatsu!

This was a glorious and unexpected experience. The broth was so rich and made me a ramen fan. They had copious and flavorful side dishes like chicken kaarage and fried rice. I stuffed myself and felt glorious afterward. I definitely will make a point to come back the next time I am in town.
Probably my favorite ramen joint so far without the long lines and 1/4 inch of oil floating on top.

My hubby and I love this Ramen Place! 

The atmosphere is very authentic and traditional :) definitely reminded me of Japan! 

I ordered the Spicy Miso and the hubs got Tonkatsu Shoyu Ramen ;) 

We finished it off with some Yuzu Sorbet (a mandarin, lemon, grapefruit, and tangerine flavor) & green tea ice cream. Overall delicious, great customer service, and food!! Best ramen place for sure. Go at the late hours.

Awesome ramen and service! I had the medium spicy miso and hubby had the combination. The broth for both was really good, especially the combination ramen. Noodles are nice and al dente, and the charsiu was soft and tasty. Compared to our most horrible ramen ever at Itsy Bitsy Ramen and Whiskey the other week, Ramen Tatsu wins hands down. Oh wait, not forgetting to mention that the one, single waitress in there during dinner rush, with her cutesy Japanese accent... she was on it, she single handedly bussed and served and checked people out, was very quick while carrying hot bowls of ramen. She was very polite never forgetting to greet and thank all the customers! We're going back again.

This place better than monta or any other ramen joint out there. Yelpers its TONKOTSU RAMEN NOT TONKATSU RAMEN LOL. (JUST SAYING). You guys give bad review but yet dont know how to pronounce or spell it haha. Well  ramen here is the best of all. Broth have a goof flavor specially the tatsu is the best noodle cooked perfect too I cant say bad about this place. Owner greet you nice everytime, service very attentive. Yes 5 stars because good food good service perfect..

One of my favorite places in town. Authentic and quality. Cute and quaint location, friendly service not sure what else you could really ask for. Ooooh I forgot to mention the best part  Asahi happy hour 3-6. :) good stuff.

I keep forgetting to check in and write a review for this place every time I'm here because when I get my food I just chow down!!!  I have a bit of a ramen addiction and if you do too this is a great place to satisfy your cravings!! I get the tonkotsu which comes with thin noodles. The broth is made from pork bone marrow and veggies boiled for many hours! It's absolutely delicious! I get no meat so they add more mushrooms for me! And if you like spicy get the spicy sauce on the side! I highly recommend to everyone!

First off, we struggled to find this place at night.  That store sign is very difficult to read. Or we are just blind.

Place is very lovely looking and decorated to suit the theme.  Very similar to the other ramen houses.  Not too packed on a Saturday night.  Menu had several choices, but tonight we were aiming for spicy.  My friend got the spicy miso and a extra spicy for myself.  *Nice little check-in bonus (1 free drink).  Now the only complaint I have is that we have to add toppings?  I was a little confused since the description for my miso said ground beef.. So I added chashu.  My ramen obviously became expensive now.. Extra cost for extra spicy and chashu.  This bowl of soup better be worth it. 

After several slurps, the spiciness  began to kick in.  Very good tasting broth, but I did not feel like it was anything special.  The spiciness was only a tad more than the regular.  The thick noodles were a nice change since we are used to getting thin types at the other places.

Service was excellent since our waitress was consistently coming around to see if we were doing okay.  

Overall, this place is not bad in my book.  It just that there are plenty of ramen houses in this area.

The Skinny: at the end of the meal, I had a half filled bowl of broth - 'nuff said (3), service: efficient and fast (3); value: it's okay - not too pricey for a bowl of okay ramen... but nothing that I feel like I need to return for (3 stars).

When we saw the signs for a new ramen joint opening up in the Chinatown area, we were stoked. We love ramen - tonkotsu ramen in particular - and we were very interested to find a ramen joint that serves the traditional thinner white noodles with their tonkotsu broth.

We headed over to their soft opening just to see what they had to offer. I believe that their menu is truncated a bit at this time. No matter - we decided to hit up their Tonkotsu ramen ($7.77, 2 pc chasu, green onion, ginger and woodear mushroom) and their Ramen Tatsu (basically a tonkotsu ramen with more chasu and in bigger bowl of noodles).

Okay, let me get this straight. Ramen for me is all about the broth. That is the most difficult part to get right and where all the flavor comes from in your bowl. If I am leaving a bowl of ramen with at least half a bowl of broth behind, that says something - it just ain't that good. The tonkotsu broth didn't have the luxurious porky depth that it needs to really distinguish itself from other ramen joints in the city.

On to the rest of the bowl. The chasu in the bowl didn't really have much of a marinated flavor with it and rendered it a bit bland. The noodles - although they were the legit kind - were a little too soft for my taste. I would also venture to say, the bright pink ginger topping should be left to the side instead of incorporated in the bowl. I was also a little sad that the wasn't the option of adding an egg to your bowl. Perhaps this oversight will be corrected after the soft opening.

Another thing of note was they did not have togarashi to go with the ramen - only the chili oil. As my hubs is a total togarashi fanboy, he was verily disappointed.

Service is quick and efficient. I believe we were in and out within half and hour.

Overall, in the big scheme of things, Ramen Tatsu is alright. However based on the offerings today, I don't feel a huge urge to return again soon.(3 starred review).

Maybe ramen just isn't my thing.   I had it a couple times at a place down the street and enjoyed it.   Tonight, was one of the saddest eating experiences of my life.  I took like 9 bites and just couldn't eat anymore because I disliked it so much.  I got the tonkotsu shoyo.   Just something about the broth tasted so bad to me.  Like something in my brain telling me that I shouldn't be eating it.   But every other review seems to think it's fantastic.  The meat in it was okay.   And I'm sure their noodles are prepared correctly but they were too hard for my taste.  

Price was reasonable at $7.77 but my mouth is in a state of morning.  

My wife is Asian and she liked what she got.   Maybe my whiteness stops me from enjoying Japanese Ramen.   

Atmosphere is cute, intimate and quiet but won't be back.
I got food poisoning here. I ordered the Tonkatsu ramen and  about 24 hours I started to feel nauseous and was vomitting the whole night.

I was here after it opened and it was great. The noodles were some of the best I'd had (thin like pho noodles but ramen recipe). Today it was garbage. The noodles are just average and the chashu had a funny taste. I won't be back.

NOT TOO SALTY.

That's what I like about Ramen Tatsu. Unlike other places, it's just too much cholesterol. Here, it's the right amount of saltiness.

It's rarely busy which makes it great. Been able to be seated once I walk in. No waits at all.

Overall, would come back for a late night dinner. Too bad they close at 10 pm.

Great ramen spot! I usually order shio and a small
fried rice. Great food with awesome customer service!

This has to be my favorite ramen place! It's just perfect for any type of weather. Went in for lunch time on Monday. And it was steady busy. My waiter Naomi was great! That's what really makes it a good place not just the food but service has to be awesome. 
They sure changed it up and it looks great! Especially the bright pictures on the menu.
This is hands down. The best ramen I've had in Vegas. The atmosphere is calm.  The resteraunt and restrooms are clean. The service is OUTSTANDING.  This place is a must visit!!

Went here with my brother yesterday and was impressed with the food and service. I had the spicy tonkotsu Ramen and the tsukemen. The tonkotsu was silky and the chashu was perfectly cooked. The tsukemen was equally good. The taste may be intense for some but ask for some hot water to thin out the dipping broth if you need to. Overall a great experience and I will go back.

Better price than the other "best ramen places" but not as overwhelmingly salty. 
Definitely be back, especially during happy hour (3-6 tues-fri)

Oh boy, I REALLY want to give this place 5 stars, but I can't. The ramen is top-shelf. VERY tasty and the food quality is so good! My main complaint is that every time I've been there, the add-ins are cold. For Pete's sake, but the extra egg in the broth so I don't have to warm it up! Now, if I ordered straight off the menu and didn't add anything, I would not have been the wiser and given 5 stars. It's THAT good! However, I don't think hot food is too much to ask for. My buddy John swears that this is the best ramen in town, but I can't abide the cold stuff on the side. Sorry, buddy. That being said, the curry ramen is pretty special. You should go for that alone. I LOVE that they are open until 11pm, as I get off work sometimes at 9:30 or 10 and can still grab a bite. They don't look at you funny for coming in late either. Parking is easy, they usually have something interesting on TV and the staff is very nice. There is this weird music thing where you hear songs you know, but not by the people you know. I find that odd.

If you want to get your ramen fix in a cozy and friendly place, then this is your place. Their noodles are nice and fresh, good consistency in terms of chewiness. Their Tonkotsu ramen broth is thick and creamy. If you don't want to wait in line for Monta (which you always will), this is a great substitute ramen restaurant that will fullfill your ramen cravings.

Tried this place out after seeing a review.  I went a little early in the evening so only two tables were occupied.  So understandably the service was attentive.  The place has two TV which happened to have the evening baseball game on, so that was an unexpected plus for me.
I got the most popular dish on the menu, as recommended by the server.  And a side of pot stickers.  The ramen was great, with a good amount of pork and veggies.  The broth had loads of flavor and the noodles were done perfectly.  I thought the pot stickers were good, but nothing great.
It had a nice simple, not too cluttered, interior.  Will definitely go back!

Cute small Ramen restaurant located in the strip mall on Jones amongst all the Chinese restaurants.very good Ramen, the best flavorful fried rice and good service. 

The tonkatsu ramen soup was shimmered and seasoned with perfection. I literally slurp the bowl with a straw leaving nothing behind. Fried rice was evenly cooked , flipped that every grain of rice was seasoned.  Honestly the best fried rice I've had for a long time.

You won't regret coming here!

I'm a little embarrassed to say that before this place I thought ramen was the dry block you eat when you are a poor college student. I knew coming to Vegas where there were many ramen choices, that I had to try the real thing. Sora and Monta seemed to be the #1 and 2 places for ramen. However, this place had great reviews and I wanted to try somewhere that wasn't the most popular. Wanted to give the little guys a chance. 

We ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu and Curry. Both were tasty but the Curry was our favorite. The broth was amazing. I still think about the broth and want some right now! It tasted homemade, flavorful and fresh. No complaints at all about the food.

I don't remember our server's name, but she was an older lady. She was very kind and on top of everything. She gave us great service.

I was overwhelmed here in Chinatown with all the choices. Glad I chose this place.

I come to LV once every few months to visit family and this is a must go! The staff are super nice. You can expect Japanese level of politeness here and after living in Japan for 4 years, the vibe and the food is most welcome. The soup for ramen is of course not at Japanese street food level but it's still very very good. Katsu don is also on point. Takoyaki is a pass though #bummer

This ramen spot is now my favorite spot to eat ramen. When I think about ramen in Vegas, I think of Ramen Tatsu because of all the variety of broths they provide. I have only tried two out of several broths (Shio and Tonkotsu Shoyu) and I love the lightness of the soup. Its not over buttered and doesn't feel so heavy. It doesn't leave that fatty taste at the end of the meal. I also love the noodles which are cooked to perfection. The chashu pieces are thicker than most places and tastes like real pork that you can actually chew on and enjoy the flavor. 
The takoyaki is also good with just the right amount of  batter and crunch. I love how they dont add too much mayo. Beautiful little babies!
The restaurant is spacious and the music they play is relaxing and smooth and adds a cafe feel to it. 
They also have curry and a saborro bowl which i have yet to try. Definitely need to try this place out!
The service is also amazing. They replace your water before you run out and they are really nice and friendly. And I love how its not as crowded and busy as monta or sora but they its not an empty restaurant.

Nice little ramen joint that is kind of hidden. Definitely an enjoyable atmosphere. They had a nice soundtrack and ambience with a quiet atmosphere. They don't serve fountain drinks here, we were given our drinks in a can, so that was a bit of a turn off, but obviously nothing that would make me not want to eat at a place (haha).  I ordered the shoyu ramen and a side order of Katsu. Both of them were great and definitely worth the try. The portions were very good and I left there full. The other 2 in my party struggled to finish, so that's a great sign on my opinion. The ramen was very well priced and so were all of the sides. I will definitely be stopping in for a bowl of ramen again, I'm interested in the other options.

We found Tatsu by accident, because we were originally going to the shabu shabu place next to it but they weren't open yet. It was happy hour (3-6pm M-F) so we got some chicken karaage and gyoza for $3 instead of the usual $4.75/order. Both things were good, with the chicken being flavorful and the gyoza nice and crispy on the edges. 

There are many options on the menu, including rice bowls. We ordered the deluxe ramen (egg, corn, bean sprouts, cabbage, seaweed, green onion, charsiu, thick noodles) and asked if we could get it with miso broth instead of the tonkotsu broth it usually comes with. Our waitress said yes, but neglected to mention that it was $1 extra. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to know. The miso broth was okay but nothing to write home about. It tasted a bit watered down to me; I've had stronger, more flavorful miso broth from a packaged ramen from the Asian grocery.  What I did enjoy was the ample amount of vegetables that came with the ramen, as it made for a texturally interesting bowl. The charsiu was tender but oddly cold in the middle, as were the egg halves. 

In short, Tatsu is a solid ramen shop if you're in the area, and they have a decent happy hour.

SO. FREAKING. GOOD!!!!! 

Ramen Tatsu is a tiny, dark restaurant in the corner of the parking lot that houses District One. The ramen here is out of this world-- Monta does not even come close to comparing. The broth is incredible (I always get the Shoyu and add an extra egg) and the noodles taste fresh. Pricing is awesome (around $7-8 for a bowl of fresh ramen), most include pork, egg and onion, and the portion sizes are great.

I can't appreciate ramen anywhere besides Ramen Tatsu anymore because of how good it is. The woman who waits on the tables and runs the register (i assume shes the owner and I've only ever had one server there) is also super polite, attentive, warm and welcoming. 

I only have great things to say about this place!

They are located next to District One. Plenty of parking space around. 

I went here couple of times and still did not like it. 

I decided to try their Tsukemen (soup on the side). Price is reasonable $10.70. 

It came with a flat thick yellow noodle. I thought the noodle was hard to chew and tasteless. The brooth was thick which was expected for Tsukemen, but it was way too salty and has a weird after taste (as if it was re-cooked many times). The charsu was okay, it was cold and taste can improved. It did not come with bamboo shoot or mushroom but it did come with boiled egg. 

Service was great, however. It was fast and timely. 
I also had the macaroon ice cream (not pictured). That's the best part of my lunch. I enjoyed it more than my ramen. 

I saw they have Happy Hour menu with great prices. So if I decided to come back, I would try their HH menu instead.

The ramen here is just amazing. My husband had the spicy sesame cold ramen and I had the curry ramen. They both were very good with plenty of flavor and not too salty. Comparing to the price that I'm used to in Washington, DC, the price here is great and they gave you plenty of food. 

Now I see why many unemployed west coast people that moved out east complain about Asian food on the east coast.

This place is fairly priced, has some really good gyoza!! What I really like about the place is the extra spicy miso. It's extremely spicy and that's what I look for in most ramen places. Best part is that the spicy isn't unbearable and the flavor is there. Literally taken most of my friend here and it's our #1 spot.

It seems like there's a new ramen place keep popping up in Vegas lately.  "Ramen Tatsu" has been around for about couple of years now, and my recent visit was my first time there.  I had a Japanese buddy of mine from San Francisco Bay Area visiting during the CES convention, and we usually go to a ramen place at least once during his visit.  This time we went to Tatsu and we were very pleased.  My buddy's name is "Tetsu" so, I remembered to go to "Tatsu."

We started with some beer and chicken kara-age (Japanese style chicken nuggets) and some pot stickers.  The pot stickers were good, but, no different than any other good ramen places. I can probably pan fry those pot stickers a little better than they can.  Kara-age was crispy outside and moist inside.  Perfect!  That shows me they're very good in deep frying.

Then we ordered our main.  My buddy ordered the "Tsukemen"  It's a thick ramen that almost look like udon noodles which comes with two types of dipping sauce.  I'm not much of a fan of eating ramen dipping it in a sauce.  I'd rather do that with a cold udon or soba.  However, those dipping sauces were delicious.  I ordered the Deluxe ramen that comes with extra slices of  cha-shu.  I can tell the cha-shu is home made, and sliced thicker than you usually see at a ramen place.  Those cha-shu were very tender and flavorful with not too much fat.  The noodle was firm and very well done, the way I like it.  Toppings were similar to the stuff I use when I make my own ramen, so, not surprised there.  Tonkotsu-Shoyu (Soy sauce based pork broth) soup was also, excellent.  Very rich broth, not oily, nor salty.  Very authentic Japanese ramen soup.  Tonkotsu-Shoyu ramen originated in Yokoyama (Kanagawa Prefecture) and, has been popular in the Kanto region (Seven eastern prefectures including Tokyo).  Tonkotsu (pork bone) ramen is basically, a traditional ramen in Kyushu.  It's like a mixture of both, Shoyu ramen of Kanto with tonkotsu ramen of Kyushu.  Tonkotsu-Shoyu ramen noodles are the regular curly ramen noodles rather than the straight thin type normally used in the Kyushu or "Hakata style" ramen.

On the scale of 1 to 10, I would give this ramen a 9.  It would've been a 10 if the cha-shu was properly seared on the outside.  The word "cha-" of "cha-shu" comes from the Chinese "chaasiu" or "char siu" which means "barbequed" or "seared" pork.  Obviously, ramen was invented by a Chinese cook in Japan, unclear of when, but, some historians say about 350 years ago; hence it uses the naming from Chinese words, and uses both Chinese and Japanese style of cooking.  At least I know it's been around for more than a century, and became popular in the 1950s.

Now I've got a place to go for Tonkotsu-Shoyu ramen!

Great little place!! There was an hour wait at Monta at 2:30 pm, I was headed to District One on Jones when I noticed Ramen Taksu next door. Glad I did! 

Small place, counted 3 booths, 4 four-top tables, a few 2 tops and a small bar seating area. Pleasant jazz music. 

Service was super sweet and fast, Tonkotsu Ramen delicious and inexpensive  ($7.77!) Perfect amounts of pork, noodles, green onions, and woodear mushrooms. Nothing beats the post Xmas blues like hot ramen and cold sake. 


??????????Ramen Tatsu!!

Had lunch with a colleague & it was fantastic! Highly recommend. Get there at 1130 before they get busy. Service was great. It's small so not a lot of room for parties but restrooms where clean & the stuff was friendly. The food came out fast & hot.

Best ramen I've ever had! Was visiting from California and happened to find this spot and went twice during the week that I stayed in Vegas. Quality of the food is good and so is the customer service. Every waitress we got was so sweet. Can't wait to come back.

This is a fabulous authentic Ramen restaurant. I have searched all over the US since my time as a student in Japan 20 years ago but never found anything that has come as close as this. The Shio Ramen was light and flavorful. The Tako Yaki reminded me of summer festival street stalls. The curry rice was delicious. I will come back here the next time in Vegas over any over priced fancy Japanese food establishment on the Strip.

came into Las Vegas for a few days and had to get a ramen fix so we tried to hit up Monta...my second favorite ramen joint...unfortunately those guys were packed but fortunately this forced me to try Ramen Tatsu. 

I got the tonkatsu spicy after the waitress told me this was her favorite and that they use habanero to make this dish spicy.  I was a bit turned off by the thin noodles that came as a default when I first saw the dish, but after eating a bit I was very impressed by the soup broth and the cha-su, which made the thin noodles a moot point.

I was only depressed by the egg, but after going to Monta a few hours later, it seems like the shops in LV don't know how to flavor the egg.  Anyways, I will be coming back for more.

I had Monta right afterwards and to be honest I think Ramen Tatsu might be better!!!

Love this place. Friendly service and the ramen is awesome! The give lots of noodles and the broth is just right. I have eaten the shoyu ramen and the miso, I was happy with both. I will continue to come here and enjoy yummy ramen.

I give this place 2 stars because of the service. I came to the restaurant on Sunday at 7pm about peak hours for dinner time, there was only 1 lady serving for whole house and the place is full.  First I ask for highchair and the lady said they don't have any. But I saw the lady bring one highchair to a new client so I told her that we come first and we are waiting for highchair and she said she forgot. After we had our food my daughter has to sit on her knee to eat while we are waiting for highchair. Once the other table with the kid left, I saw 1 highchair available BUT she give that highchair to the new group that walking in the restaurant. My husband walk to that table and said we are waiting for highchair but the server said "Oh! sorry I already gave it to the new table. So the entile meal my daughter has to sit on her knee and on my lap to eat because the stupid server never care about us. My husband soup was cold and service is very slow. Disappointed.

We were recently in town for a tournament and the night before I we left town, we wanted to get something light to eat as we had been pigging out the whole trip. Ramen came to mind and we narrowed it down to two options. Monta and Ramen Tatsu. We ended up chosing Ramen Tatsu for its close proximity to us and we were glad we did.

The establishment was nice and clean, and though the restaurant isn't exactly large, there was plenty of space for us. The vibe was relaxed, which was a welcomed change of pace from our trip. The waitress was super attentive and pleasant.

The offerings on the menu was fairly diverse, so... if you didn't feel like Ramen, you definitely had a lot of other options. Food was tasty and priced very well.

5 stars out of 5. Good food. Easy to get to. Relaxed environment. Not expensive. Definitely coming back to here soon!
