We were at Ramen Tatsu at 9-930PM on a Friday night. The parking lot gets kind of packed due to the surrounding businesses. Leave a little early to account for parking. Being late for a date is not attractive. :P
Love, love, love this little hole in the wall! Takoyaki and tsukemen are both delish and service was quick. Servers are always polite even when the place is packed out the door.

Place not too busy, quick service . My boyfriend ask about broth and the waitress gave him feedback about  the broth. I order tonkotsu shoyu It quite delicious and it not too big. , I will order it again. It quiet place and gorgeous decoration themes. It almost feel I am in Japan hidden gem restaurant.

Cool Ramen spot! Not very big and had an awesome atmosphere! 

The decor felt like I was in Japan. Cool Japanese decorations and they even have 2 tv's. I was able to enjoy watching a NFL game while having dinner.

The staff is super nice! They made sure we were well taken cared off and followed up with us to make sure everything was ok.

Let's get down with the food! I had the Katsu Curry! I know i know why order Katsu Curry at a Ramen joint but the picture in the menu got me! I knew I had to try it! The bowl was huge and the curry was not too spicy! The chicken was juicy and crust had a nice texture. 

Overall I enjoyed this place! I liked that it was intimate and staff gave great service.
I don't know why more people don't come here for ramen. I personally think its better than Monta- not as salty. and there is never a wait. The staff are friendly and attentive.

Flavorful broth with the right amount of fattiness. 
The noodles are  Al Dente.
The poached eggs are perfectly cooked. 
The chicken Karage is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside
The staffs are friendly and service is excellent.
Loveeee their Happy hour!!! 
Highly recommend this ramen joint to all

I wouldn't say that it's better than Sora or Monta, but it's definitely a good place to go if the other two are packed. I must admit, it was a fluke to eat here because Ramen Sora had an hour wait and Asian BBQ and noodle had a ridiculous amount of people. So, we looked at the reviews and bam...Seated in 20 mins! 

They clean up tables quick and the turn around is great. The server was apologetic when she didn't need to be while we were waiting for the food. 

Their tonkatsu was good, and just what I needed to warm up from the cold weather. The chashu is fatty as heck...So good! I'd come back! =)

Best ramen I've had and at the best price. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen with an egg and the broth was perfectly balanced, creamy, but not too heavy. My boyfriend got the shoyu ramen which was also very rich and complex. Noodles were cooked perfectly. Service is also very friendly and fast! 

Only in Vegas for 3 days and came here twice

This spot is probably my favorite go-to ramen place. It's tucked in a small storefront in the plaza, so it can be a bit hard to spot if you don't know what you're looking at. When you enter the restaurant, you're almost instantaneously greeted by the server. Usually, they only have one on duty, but they always provide stellar service (and they're always really nice!).

When it comes to the food, I have absolutely no complaints. Their ramen is great. I've had them all (even the vegetarian one which is surprisingly good). They have the perfect level of richness and creaminess without it being too overwhelming and the broth isn't overly salty. Their curry is also pretty tasty and very filling. Their menu has decent variety and happy hour appetizers are a great deal.

Totally recommend this is as a very chill and casual ramen joint.
The best ramen place we've gone to!! Naomi is the sweetest server!! Thank you for you time!!

We got ramen, takoyaki, and the seared char-siu. Everything was really delicious, and the service was great! The servings are more generous than most ramen places, so I would wait before ordering noodle refills (I made this mistake). The takoyaki especially was melt-in-your-mouth good, so I would definitely recommend getting that! I agree with the other reviewers in that the ramen here isn't overly salty as is typical of ramen restaurants, which is wonderful. 

What's also cool is that you have the option to tailor not just the toppings but also the spiciness level of your ramen to your taste. Would definitely recommend on your trip to Vegas!

The restaurant is really small, but the seating is really comfortable. The ramen here is 7 to 10 bucks each and they are really delicious. I also really like the curry katsu.

The owner of the restaurant is a small Japanese woman- she is so sweet and also provides me with the best service! 

Of the many ramen spots I've visited, this is my favorite ramen spot in Las Vegas.

My sister and I are ramen fanatics and read some great reviews about this place. It definitely sustained our ramen craving. The broth was great, noodles were perfect for me, and the pork was so flavorful and even had a hint of sweetness. 

Our server was the sweetest lady ever! Makes the experience even better!

We will definitely be regulars here!

I'm updating my review to five stars. This has become a regular dinner spot for my fiancé and I and it continues to impress. We have tried almost everything and it's all great. I love this place and believe it to be the best ramen spot in town.

It was ok. Wasn't that impressed. My husband and I we're both craving for ramen and we wanted to try this place out. Wait wasn't too long. It was when we started to order, brought our food out, drinks we're missing. I had to keep calling the waitress because she kept forgetting to bring us what we needed. No utensils, no straw, and i think she didn't know how to multitask but she even left her dirty towel that they used to wipe all the tables. Like literally it was right next to my water, i had to move it myself.
Food was ok, Monta Ramen's still way better
Great ramen! This is my new go to place in Vegas. Very good service as well. Two thumbs up.

This place is a ramen heaven!!! Everything is spot on here-the service, the food, the atmosphere, everything!! We were a group of 5 tired and hungry people and were all beyond happy with the overall experience here. The server was very friendly and helped us with the order. Never did she fail to smile and made sure that our glasses were filled to the brim at all times!! Though it was pretty late (almost toward the closing time) on a weekday, the quality of food and service didn't lack a thing. The spicy miso ramen couldn't be any better. Have had so many ramen all around the country, and this to me, is one of the bests. If you like your ramen spicy, spicy miso is the ramen for you. The tonkatsu ones are scrumptious as well. The broths were creamy (but not too much), keeping it just perfect and they all tasted awesome. My sister in law loved their fried rice as well. Oh, don't forget to order their takoyaki; it was aaammaazing!
I would definitely be back here whenever I'm visiting the area.

This place made me sad I was looking forward to coming here. The staff was nice and the place looked cool but the food man....the food wasn't that good. I got tonkatsu shoyu and it had a weird off taste to it. My grandpa got the karaga and it tasted off too. The pork was good had nice flavor but was tough its like i needed a knife to cut it. :( This is the first time I had a bad review for a ramen place and it makes me sad.

Slightly disappointed in the flavor of the broth, the texture of the ramen, and the overall experience of my tonkatsu ramen. I guess you can say I've been spoiled with ramen from LA and SF, so my expectations were pretty high for Ramen Tatsu. Maybe I came in on an off day because I certainly did not experience their 4.5 star reputation on yelp. The tonkatsu broth was the slightest bit tasty and wasn't fatty enough for my taste. The ramen, although generous in portion, was not al-dente but soggy as if it had been sitting in the bottom of the bowl for hours. The toppings didn't come with much: mound of green onions, two slices of cha siu,  and wood ear. I added my own egg, which was probably my favorite part of the ramen.

Nonetheless, the service was great! Green tea was perfect for a rainy night and to soothe my throat. I probably won't be coming here again with Jinya only a short drive away.
Best ramen noodles prepared to your liking. Not salty and very tasty. Great price for the quality of food. Definitely will come back here when in Vegas!

I really enjoyed this shop. It's small and intimate with great service and I loved their music. Nice band relaxing and great service. I enjoyed the ramen and so did everyone else in my party. Everyone commented that it was one of the best they have had. Will be returning!

Apparently I've been to this spot twice now, but I can't remember much about the taste of the ramen I had a few years back. My uncle and I came here because our favorite place, Yagyu, closed down.
My recent visit I actually ordered Tsukemen. I don't believe I have ever tried tsukemen before, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I was pleasantly surprised with my order.
With tsukemen, your noodles come out on the side, and you dip the noodles into a broth that's thicker and more flavorful than regular ramen broth. 
They allow you to order 3x or more noodles servings for just a few bucks more; I went with 2x.
Noodles are thicker than typical ramen and very chewy which I normally don't like for ramen, but went very well with tsukemen. Toppings included the standard chashu, egg, etc., and a wedge of lime.
There seems to be only one kind of broth for the tsukemen, which I believe was tonokotsu shoyu with bonito.
I'll have to get the tsukemen again the next time I'm visiting Vegas!

We came in after lunch time but this place was still packed! Luckily we got our table without having to wait. This place is very little so just be prepare to wait. 

We ordered the takoyaki and I chose the spicy tonkatsu and my husband chose the deluxe one. 

The takoyaki was a dead bomb!! It was very very good. The best takoyaki we ever had. The inside was very creamy and soft. If only we live in Vegas, I'd order 2 more if I'm not worry about getting to full on my foodie trip. 

My spicy tonkatsu was dang delicious. The broth was rich and it had a little kick. The tonkatsu melted in your mouth. The noodles were perfectly cooked, had a texture bite, al dente as Italian says. 

My husband's food was also very delicious. It came with everything as it's the deluxe one. 

The girls was very friendly. I can't wait to go back for this ramen and their takoyaki.

This place is super cute and has amazing service! Party of three with a baby and we were immediately seated and they brought my son a special cup and bowl. So cute! I got the kimchi as an appetizer and woooo was it super tangy! I got the veggie ramen and it was so good!! The broth was so good I barely added anything too it (just some chili oil lol). More importantly my son loved it! He loved the egg rolls and he even ate the kimchi! But he loved the noodles and the broth! I even took leftovers of the ramen and he ate it later that night! The only thing that sucked was it is cash only right now so either call ahead to double check or bring cash. Would definitely come back! And I love that they have veggie options!

I enjoyed not having to wait in a long line. originally we were going to to Monta Ramen but choose to save time and try something else. I was happy with the ramen and the service. it was clean and friendly staff.

Restaurant size is pretty small but extremely cozy and homey! The staff member is extremely nice and super helpful! 

My sibling and I were craving ramen for the longest time and we didn't have a chance to eat it... Until now! 

I got the spicy miso with an egg and my sibling got something (I totally forgot) that thhe made spicy with an egg as well. We both picked the ones with the thick noodles and it was HEAVENLY!! 

The ramen broth is cooked long and slow in a slew of veggies and bone broth so that it is nice and creamy. The noodles are the right consistency that slurp right off your spoon to your mouth. Even better, the egg was cooked to PERFECTION! Soft yolk, hard boiled white and the yolk had a tiny but of juice left but just oh so creamy in your mouth.

This place is a must try if you are craving ramen or if it's a gloomy day or cold day or any day for that matter of fact! I suggest adding an egg!!!

I came here on a Wednesday afternoon, around 2-3 PM. We were greeted right away by a super friendly host.

My sister and I both got the deluxe, and it was really good. The menu is really easy to understand and they have pictures for all of us that aren't experts at ramen and ramen toppings/add-ins. We got a free can of soda with our Yelp check-in. 

I would go back here. There is a lot of competition in town, so I can't say it's my favorite ramen spot, but the pork was perfectly cooked and flavored well.

Also, they charge so much for mochi. I went across the street to 168 Market and got my mochi fix there, for a lot cheaper.

If grading on service alone this place is 5 stars. The chick working the front end was working her butt off. Taking orders, waitressing, filling water, taking payment. This was saving this place from 2 stars.

I hate leaving a less than 5 stars for a small, 1 location place, BUT, this place is over rated. Everything was MEH. Wayyyyy to much sesame oil in the broth and the other ingredients were cheap and tasteless.  Bitter green cabbage, cold mushroom fungus, the soft boiled egg was good.

Save your $10, buy a pack of instant ramen at the store, add a soft boiled egg and a piece or two of ham lunch meat, and you will be equally satisfied.

Hands down one of the most delicious tasting broths! The crew is very friendly, the food is really delicious! I have had plenty of Ramen from many places, including those famous in LA and this ramen is definitely worth saying is one of my top favorites! Two thumbs up!
Stopped in spur of the moment since the other restaurant was packed. This place was amazing and the flavor was out of this world. I would come back again. This is what hole in the wall means.

I had miso ramen, my cohort had shio ramen. I also ordered karrage chicken and gyoza. 
I was in my ramen happy place. My partner not so much. Shio tasted off to her and she felt it had too much oil floating on top. I gave her the rest of my broth for her noodles she liked that much better. Service was great. Need more non-caffine drink offerings as a suggestion. Coconut water ect.

I tried the spicy miso soup, it was delicious. I added an extra hard boiled egg and mushrooms. I didn't like how their menu only had pork options, I really enjoy chicken ramen, but nonetheless it was good. The fried oysters were really good, they came with cabbage salad and a tasty, what wasted like barbecue sauce. The potstickers were good but again, pork. The service was great, the place is small and cozy really giving those authentic vibes.

New ramen place, and it's good. It's a nice change from the oh so popular straight Tonkotsu ramen. Albeit, that's my favorite. This one is tonkotsu yes, but the broth isn't as thick and relentless as you tonkotsuites may be used to. Def recommend getting the deluxe as you get 4 pieces of chashu, a full egg, kikurage, negi (green onions), and noodles. The only downside is the soup isn't very hot. I usually like it when the broth comes in piping hot.

Also got a side of gyoza. The gyoza is delicious, however it is super garlicky so expect to bring some breath mints with you at the very least. Or don't eat it at all before heading out to the strip. Unless you like honey badger and you don't care. Got the Karaage as well. My mom and I both thought it would be a chicken drumstick as advertised in the picture but alas no, it wasn't. And it was the least tasty at our table.

As for price - I think it's reasonable. And the service isn't bad at all. Get here before everyone notices there's a new ramen spot in town!

Customer service is awful. The food alone would have gotten a four star. However, we ordered appetizers and ramen, and the appetizers arrived when I was nearly finished with my ramen. We then waited for our check, long enough to write this review.

It was love at first visit with this place! Came here the first time sort of by accident and I'm really glad I did. I've tried 5 of their ramens which were all amazing. My favorite is their Spicy Miso and their matcha cheesecake with a hot cup of green tea is a perfect finish to the meal. I always end up here on really cold nights and the food and the atmosphere totally warms my soul. 10/10

Pretty good experience at ramen tatsu. If you don't want to wait Monta, this could be an option. It's not quite up to par with Monta's chashu but everything else is pretty close. I'm also pretty sure they use the same distributor for their noodles as Monta. Overall I give this place 4 stars, which in my book is still pretty good!

I love coming here for happy hour! Apps are a few bucks cheaper. Large Asahi draft is $4. Order a ramen as well. This place is clean. The service is excellent! Plus, you can add extra noodles or kaedama if you are still hungry! The noodles come on the side and you can add them to your leftover broth.

My ultimate favorite ramen place!! Came back from Japan and it felt like I was still there. From the ramen broth to the takoyaki..so authentic!! Then to finish the meal I got the yuzu sorbet and it topped it all off!! It had the right combo of sour and sweet!! Finally on top of it all the service and atmosphere. It was so low key and had cushions to sit on! And the girls..they are always nice and take care of your every need! I  ramen tatsu!!!! 

P.s. Get the iced green tea. They always refill and let you take a to go cup!!

My general rule of thumb before heading out for ramen is to put on an old t-shirt. I'm a mess when I eat and usually end up with a couple spots of broth from the soup on some part of my shirt. My visit to Ramen Tatsu was no different. No matter how careful I am, I end up wearing some of my lunch. It was worth it, though, to try their tonkotsu ramen ($7.77). While it wasn't as creamy as I'd like -- the broth was thinner and more diluted -- the pork flavor was hearty. I'm not a fan of the really thin noodles, which were too al dente, but the tender pork with its rendered fat made up for it. The slivers of fat provided an excellent burst of flavor with each bite. Located in the same plaza as District One and Chada Thai, it can be tough to find parking during peak hours.
Wonderful Shoyu Ramen! Huge portions! Nice quiet atmosphere! Karage was delicious! No complaints and amazing iced green tea!!!

I really enjoyed the tonkatsu at Ramen Tatsu. They are generous with the ingredients here and the tonkatsu was creamy and savory without the overpowering saltiness that some other ramen places serve. And man, when that bowl of ramen arrives, it's just gorgeous. Picture-perfect for all you asians, like me, who love to document their meals. Their chashu pork, although not very flavorful, is still pretty tasty. On my second visit, I got the idea to order the seared chashu and add it to my ramen. Yummy! They should totally have this option for toppings. The noodles were thinner in the tonkatsu but I didn't mind it. You probably can request the thicker noodles. A nice plus is that you can get a refill of noodles (kaedama) for only $1.50.

The restaurant is still pretty new so it has that awkward ambience of a place just starting up and the menu seems to be a work in progress. Would love to see this place do well amidst the growing number of ramen shops around town.

Definitely my new go to place for ramen. As soon as I discovered the Deluxe bowl it was over. The taste is so savory and you get a large serving. The service quality is very good. It's a nice mom and pop shop hidden in the Mountain View Plaza. If you don't want too long of a wait and something satisfying check this place out!

My new favorite ramen obsession! 

I don't know why it's taken me forever and a day to eat here. Usually when I go to a ramen place, I measure them by their gyoza and their miso ramen. I actually haven't tried the miso ramen yet here because I've been getting their delicious tsukemen! Their version has a strong fish flavor and reminded me of David Chang's Mind of A Chef where he looks into making bonito in Japan. Their egg is perfectly soft-boiled and the chasu served cold is thick and full of flavor. The noodles are extra thick, firm, and flatter than your normal ramen noodle in order to increase surface area for dipping. My husband has ordered the tonkatsu shoyu, which also has a fishy taste. He enjoyed it and his leftovers were still delicious the next day, which I attribute to the noodles holding up very well. As far as sides go, the gyoza meat was a bit dry, so I probably wouldn't order that again, but the curry rice and the side salad are satisfying and filling. The kimchi fried rice isn't too spicy, which I liked, but may be a turn-off for those who want kimchi fried rice from a Korean restaurant. Their iced green tea is not canned or bottled, which is an extra plus for me. It's only $1.77 too with free refills! (a lot of their pricing ends in .77 cents). To top it all off, they have two TVs that are angled strategically for maximum viewing pleasure and the servers here handle their business efficiently and are very helpful/friendly. I'll be back for more :D
The first time we came they had just opened and were empty, but we lived the food. Tonight they were packed and the noodles are still amazing! My favorite noodle house

Favorite Ramen Spot!! I've tried a few of their ramen flavors and they're are delicious! Staff is sweet and works as fast as possible! I came here most of my pregnancy and never had to get angry about my food lol.

Parking sucks at night, haha. But what else can you expect being in LV's chinatown? Small mom & pop restaurant, but oh so yummy! The food is resonably priced which is a plus. The gyoza was tender and melts in your mouth. Spicy tonkatsu ramen was filling and doesn't have too much salt in it, like other ramen spots in town. Server was attentive. I'll be a regular from now on!
Everything on the menu is recommended. That is all. One of the best ramen places in town.

I love this place!!!! :)

The ambience is wonderful, the shoyu ramen is phenomenal and the tonkatsu is delicious!! Very cheap and very wonderful. My bf and I are making this our new ramen spot!

We ordered the Spicy Tonkotsu and Curry Ramen with side of eggs and bean sprouts. Really liked the tenderness of the char siu, the egg and bean sprout perfectly cooked. But the ramen and broth alone was nothing special in my opinion. We came in at 0200pm and it was pretty empty. Comparing to Hawaii prices, it's cheap for what you get!
holy sh*t shizuka was the bomb she can memorize the most complicated orders. ask for her
This was my first ramen ever and i do not regret that I chose this place. The service is great and food awesome and prices rly low. Place to go for ramen.

So far been here for fifteen minutes. One waitress running around, not even acknowledging anyone that walks in. Not even eye contact as she walks by. Some guy in the back came out, scanned the dining area, and glanced over at waiting area. Not even a smile or acknowledgment. Lots of seats available. Horrible service already and I haven't even made my order. So... am i supposed to seat myself?

I alway love the ramen it traditional. most of the other places I go to are not, I have been here more than 30 times. It has always been great and the service too. This place has real Japanese service. The price is reasonable and the Food comes out quick.

This is my favorite place.  I go to many ramen shops.  The ramen here is not to salty.  Just right.  I've been here for lunch and dinner.  Bring my business associates here for lunch.  May be they can serve breakfast, that would be great.

I've been to many different ramen places this would be my second choice. They don't have variety of toppings. The flavor was good. The ramen noodles were different from other ramen spots this was more closer to cu of noodles lol but I would go back again.
Came to vegas on vacation. Checked this place out in yelp and it is amazing! The food is awesome! The waitress is very helpful and generous!
I love this ramen spot. I like my ramen spicy and they deliver! Super yummy and the service it great. The lady who works the front is bubbly and adorable. I will definitely  become a regular here.
Really good ramen! Had the spicy miso with an egg. Egg was cooked perfectly just the way I like it. I love the small atmosphere here. Will always be back for more!
Excellent food! It was my first time trying ramen and I would definitely recommend this place. Try the spicy miso. It'll open up your pores with all the spicy, juicy flavors
Food was great and the server was really nice and friendly. Portions are generous and the ramen was really good and comforting.

We love, love, love ramen in our family. We have five people in our family and we all ordered a different ramen dish. Everyone loved what they ordered. That is hard to come by in a family of five. Super impressive!! Prices are great as well. Our server was amazing. We will definitely be there often. You should try this place for sure. You will not be disappointed.

Overall a good bowl of ramen- hard to compare to the other ramen places, although it did need a touch more salt.. The portion siZe was not big enough for my husband though so we had to order a side of gyoza- they have Purified Water which I really liked cause it didn't have that bad metal taste! bomb water! The atmosphere and service was very nice and friendly although I think that they are still in training a bit-- no problems though-- 
I'd go back if I were in the mood and in the area--

My new favorite ramen in town.  I love monta, sora and this place. this place being the least expensive with great flavor. The soup is very thick which is my favorite style. I do not care for light broth ramen. Plus this is much less known than Sora or Monta, almost no wait at 4pm when I got there. Love it.

I've been eating ramen in Las Vegas for probably 4-5 years. I've had Monta, Fukumimi, and Ramen Sora and eventually figured there wasn't anything else that could be done to outdo any of the others. Recently I went to Ramen Tatsu and loved everything about it. Most importantly: curry ramen. I've never seen this on the other menus so I got the extra spicy version and it was amazing. I loved the atmosphere too: it wasn't too crowded and the service was very friendly. I was also glad they weren't playing top 40 hits like a lot of the other Japanese restaurants seem to be doing. I noticed they have a happy hour with discounted appetizers and beer but it apparently didn't apply during the holiday season. I will definitely come back here just for the curry ramen and I'd love to try the tsukemen too.
Awesome Ramen, Love the winter time the most for fresh hot Ramen. This place never lets us down and is often crowded but worth the wait!

Why is it that I have to go to Las Vegas to have the best ramen outside of Japan?  There isn't a place in Los Angeles or Orange County that comes close to this place.  If you're visiting Las Vegas, this place is a must visit.

I have been to many ramen places but this is  the most humble and delicious ramen I have ever had. The fusion and intricate favor of the habanero spice and soup of spicy tonkotsu ramen one to remember and crave. If I am into some good Japanese ramen or rice, I go here.
My favorite spot for Ramen !!! You need to try this place !!. Great food, service, music and atmosphere.

Ordered: 
Spicy Tonkatsu ramen - added egg

The service is always awesome! Super friendly and very attentive. The ramen was very delicious and the spice level is adjustable. They make the soup spicy with their homemade concoction of ghost chili and habanero. I love spicy food so this was a big plus!! Sooo good!!

if youre looking for a late night ramen craving, i would definitely recommend this place.. 

Pros: -ramen is fresh! 
           -they have a lil bit more selection of finger food       than most ramen place. 
           -price is affordable.

Cons: a little bit slow bringing the food for a slow night. 

i still give it a 5 star coz the food taste  over powered the slow process of bringing food out

I will NEVER go back to this place. We showed up 45 minutes before closing and they were only excepting cash and they told us we had to come back with cash after we sat down and began to order. Came back and sat down and then they said they were going to close in 30 minutes and we would have to leave right at 11. So you want me to wait for my food for 20 minutes because it takes that long normally for them to bring my food, then you want me to scarf it down in 10 minutes? Hell no. Never again, horrible service and horrible servers. I'll stick to Jinya.

Everytime we are in Vegas Ramen Tatsu ends up being our next day hang over meal.  All of the Ramen choices are super delicious.  customer service is always great very inviting and pleasant place to have a meal.  Chicken Karage and Tonkotsu with egg is my go to cant lose choice.  If youre into Ramen you will not be disappointed.  Highly recommended

I think Ramen Tatsu was comparably tastier than any LA restaurant I've tried. My mom got the shoyu ramen while I chose the spicy miso ramen. The spicy miso ramen, especially, was amazing. Service was great too. Such sweet and nice people. Definitely coming here again!

First time here today. Found it by accident during lunch across the street and came here for dinner. The Ramen broth is excellent! We have three different kinds of Ramen and two kinds of rice. All very authentic tasting. Service was excellent, fast, and very attentive. They brought out bowls for the kids without asking. Waitress was super nice as well. Prices very very reasonable and could easily be a couple dollars higher anywhere else. Would love to come back here again on our next trip to Las Vegas.
Ramen here is so good but I think if they're have make by your own It's gonna be good too. I recommend just 1 Ramen with 1 App you will be full. Lol.

I'm not so superstitious but that stuff does make me curious.  Good tasty fulfilling ramen starts at $7.77. Add toppings for $0.77.  Seven ingredients: Tonkatsu shoyu broth, ramen noodles, chasiu, mushrooms, green onion, soft eggs, and garlic chips.  Satisfying!  

Ate here a couple times and both visits were cuz I had a cold.  Normally hot chicken soup with hearty veggies will comfort me.  That's a saying...  Something about their ramen here will do the job just as well.  Those garlic chips!  I know garlic is great for high blood pressure and colds.

Can't say this is the absolute remedy for feeling under the weather.  But my ear was clogged up for three days and the head cold was just hanging out.  It needs to leave.  Ramen Tatsu to the rescue!  In the morning, my ear finally drained.  I can hear!

This is just my take on their soup.  I do love it.  It's affordable and tastes really good.  I don't leave leftovers.  I have my fave ingredients for my cold remedy I suppose.  It works so I'll stick with it.  How's that?  :)

Wow!  I've been wanting to try a Ramen place for a while and my friends at work keep inviting me when they go.  I finally did and I was glad that I did!

I got the Curry Ramen Tatsu which was absolutely delicious and the write temperature.  HOT! But not too hot.  I quickly devoured the noodles I had and then ordered extra noodles for $1.50.  Totally worth it.  

It was perfect.  Hit the spot juuuuuust right.  Not too much, not too little.  

The women that was serving us was awesome and right on top of it.  The place was a little small, but don't let that deter you from an awesome Ramen Experience.

I can't wait to bring my wife here!

- Very Clean.
- Excellent Service.
- DELICOUS FOOD!

Really liked this place!  Small and hidden off Jones. Don't get discouraged about the parking, it's pretty much like that in Chinatown all over. Food is worth the wait, so stick it out. The ramen here is fresh and very flavorful. Must try the shoyu ramen. That broth is killer! Make sure to add the extra items to yours...they are priced very reasonably. 
Waitress was real sweet and attentive.  We were a large party...came 1 1/2 before close. Didn't feel rushed at all.  
Will visit again

Loved this place! We always went to monta then we went to this place and the atmosphere is more relaxed. More family oriented and the pork is extremely flavorful! The waitress is so welcoming and sweet too.

Chasu bowl is amazing. I love the charcoal smell in chasu, the ramen w fat meat melt right on your mouth. Service is friendly and attentive. Definitely go back again

Ps: ramen broth is not salty at all

Just another Vegas restaurant with great ramen.  There's so many in town and each have their own preference, but Ramen Tatsu is definitely a good option.  This place serves their ramen a little differently where you can add the ingredients as you go rather than get a full ramen soup.  I ordered the spicy tonkatsu with added spicy sprouts and corn.  The base was actually quite spicy which is nice as most of the time I need to drench the soup in peppers or hot sauce to get a good kick.  The noodles were of the very thin variety and just ok.  The chasu was very good, with a nice line of fat for better flavor.  I'd say the broth was the best part of the meal with the chasu placing second.  The rest of the accompaniments were just average.  Not my favorite ramen in town but a true contender.  My entire meal was a little over $10 which is on the cheaper side for this dish.  I recommend trying Tatsu as it is a high quality rendition and lives up to its Vegas counterparts.

This review is long over due as with my other ones.  But I'm finally revisiting my draft reviews in preparation for my upcoming trip to sin city.  I want new spots to try out or do I make a come back? 

This ramen house was recommended to me by one of my yelper friend whom I wish would write more reviews of all these places he grubs at.  And this boy eats out ALOT and is always trying new places out!

Anyway.  We finally made it here.  I went with my usual preference of
Tonkotsu ramen c seaweed, tamago, green onions, butter and chaschu.  Loved the consistency of the broth and flavors were right on.  You know,  fatty and all! =)  Ramen was al dente.  Perfect.  I was actually very pleased.
 
We ordered a side of gyoza.  Ofcourse.  Was good.  And we also ordered a side of tonkatsu to share.  Delish.

Service was prompt  and polite.  I was pleased our waitress spoke Nihongo.  It authenticated my dining experience here.

So I might definitely return!
Very good variety of ramen and dishes that most Japanese Ramen restaurants offer. Their Chicken Karaage is excellent. We also enjoyed their pork chashu which were really tender and flavorful.

I found this place due to the long wait at Monta and I've been coming here ever since! The food here is just as good, maybe even better! Best part is never having to wait. That may change after people start to discover this gem...but I feel obliged to brag about the quality and service of this place. Enjoy!
If you like ramen you have to go here and try it. The ramen is excellent. The service is great and the staff is friendly. Every time I visit Las Vegas this is definitely one of my stops!
Good quality and reasonable price. Gyoza was good too! Love this restaurant.
I'm a huge fan of their spicy habanaero ramen! The resturant is quiet and feels very authentic. This is my new favorite place for ramen!

Ramen is amazing. Tonkatsu ramen...YUMMY!!  Always add an egg...they cook it perfectly!  Love their fried rice  and had the tonkatsu cutlet for the first time...literally the best I've had.  Good sauce on the side and a great cabbage salad too!  Comes with the tonkatsu!  Come try it. Great prices...good people!

The ramen was pretty tasty and I've tried a few ramen shops in my day.  I do have my favorites such as the Ramen shop in Mitsuwa - Hokkaido Santouka (Costa Mesa) and Shin-Sen-Gumi Hakata Ramen - Fountain Valley (this stuff is made by the gods or something).

Anyhow this delicious bowl was quite filling and flavorful as well as a good value for the money.  I went for the Tonkatsu Shoyu Deluxe(~$11).  The broth and noodles was also strong like a virile Siberian Husky in Siberia leading a Siberian Husky Sled team over the frozen tundra of Siberia with a heavy set Siberian Eskimo on board.

After a hard day of 'rastling boulders at Krafts in Red Rock nothing hits the spot after a cold day like Ramen. You don't want Pho, you want Ramen made by the gentle hands of an older Japanese woman slaving away in the back kitchen or a stocky hispanic guy name Enrique (same thing).

From start to finish the ramen stayed strong and powerful.

Yummy factor 7.8 outta 10.4.
Decent ramen place with good portions. I also think the price is right. Had the Tonkasu Ramen with egg. Taste right. Also had fried rice. I'd definitely return to this place.

This is by far my favorite ramen spot in town. Feels so cozy and comfortable to eat here. I love the shio ramen, medium spicy with a passion, it is my absolute favorite. I have tried other ramen here, but I usually go back to shio every time. The takoyaki is really good as an appetizer and I love the cute macaroons filled with ice cream for dessert. The deluxe ramen is so delicious, but you've got to have a huge appetite to be able to eat it all. The fact that I can have a hot green tea or a Sapporo with my ramen is just the icing on the cake. Love this place.

I like the fact that we got a free drink just by checking in, and it wasn't just a fountain drink. 

Food is great!  Like the option of having a the spicy options for noodles,  not sure if that's original from Japan or not.. But I like it. 

Like the menu they have a few more options that  Monta,  and small enough not to be confusing.  

The taste... a couple of notches under montas taste, but you can't beat the fact that there is no waiting time.

Very rich noodle soup.
They shorted me on noodle soup so that they can charge extra for extra soup refill, which I thought it was a little shady.
But overall good Ramen.
This is an ok place for ramen it wasn't the best ramen I have had in town but it is pretty good . Place is quiet and the staff are really nice.

Finally, we found Ramen Tatsu! I swear, it was like finding Waldo. I'm not going to blame my poor vision on having missed the sign the first time I attempted to visit. Its signage can easily be missed. Just look for District One and you'll eventually spot Ramen Tatsu.

When we arrived, the restaurant was surprisingly empty on a Saturday around dinnertime, but it was nice having the place to ourselves. I ordered the Tonkotsu and my boyfriend ordered the Spicy Miso. By the way, the marinated soft boiled egg doesn't come with the ramen. It's an additional $1 charge for an item commonly free at other ramen restaurants. 

Tonkotsu Ramen - The broth had a meaty flavor. Noodles were firm, thin, and cooked well. Pork was fatty, fat, fat. The green onions were on the heavy side.

Spicy Miso - Unless you want to feel more heat, there's no need for additional red pepper. If you've had the spicy miso at Jinya, this is comparable to theirs. 

Being the only diners in the restaurant, service was quick and we received our hot bowls of ramen in an instant. 

The food is decent, and we didn't pay over $10 for each of our orders.

Great all around spot for ramen and curry. Most of the tourist flock to other spots like Monta, but there
are plenty of great alternatives like Tatsu without the ridiculous wait.

Ramen Tatsu is great! I heard about it from a coworker who recommended it for ramen lovers like myself. The service is great here! Although there was only one server, she had great energy & was very attentive with all her tables. The ramen soup portions are pretty big so expect to come out feeling full & satisfied! The menu is simple & offers several different options. It also offers separate topping options for your choice of ramen. The environment is cozy & the decor is simple. The crafted decor caught my eye, it reminded me of the crafted decor from Colombia, full of detail! I will definitely be coming back here soon. Its on my side of town & it has left me wanting more!
A pretty interesting Ramen joint through and through.  The service is great and the waitress is fantastic, but I'm not so sure about the broth.  Otherwise, it's solid.

I will definitely come back!!! Their takoyaki is awesome! Plus a tasty large serving of tonkatsu was bomb too (especially if you eat it with the takoyaki sauce and kimchi rice) i am in love.

And, don't forget to grab dessert. Maybe a mango cheesecake and vanilla ice cream will complete the experience.

Prices are really low too compared to other places. 

Giving the employees 5 stars too. I love it!

This ramen place did not disappoint.  I ordered the Tatsu deluxe ramen and was pleasantly surprised by the thickness of the charsiu and also the flavour of the broth base. They also did not skimp on the other ingredients.  There was plenty of bean sprouts, green onion, and two pieces of nori.  The only thing they could have improved on was to give a little bit more ramen in the bowl.  Otherwise this ramen was quite delicious and I finished all the soup, which I don't usually do.  I also tried their fried rice but was not as impressed with it.  It was not flavourful enough and the presentation was not pretty.  It also had quiet a few dices of pure fat in it.  My recommendation, stick with the ramen and you will be back for more.  I give 3.5 stars.
Very good ramen. Great thick noodles  The pork belly was melt in your mouth! Everyone got a different broth base and all were very happy.
The restaurant is clean and neatly, the server is a Japanese woman, she is friendly and politeness. I was ordered spicy miso ramen and ice green tea. The food come quickly and taste good.

Small mom and pop restaurant right next to District One. Look carefully or you'll easily miss it. Simple menu but oh soooo delicious! I ordered the shoyu ramen and added kikurage (wood ear mushrooms) and nori (seaweed) my son ordered the miso ramen without corn and bean sprouts. Broth is so tasty and service was excellent. You can pretty much customize your ramen by adding "extras" or omit whatever you don't like. And, If you love eating your ramen with hot mustard, like me, don't be afraid to ask for it. They have a delicious Japanese mustard that complements your ramen  Definitely my new fave spot!

We had the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen and the Katsu Curry.  However, I prefer the Ramen over at Monta and the Katsu Curry at Tonkotsu Kiyoshi.  The chasiu was still cold...not rich and delectable at Monta.  The Katsu was dry and the curry was too thin.  This ramen shop is more spacious than Monta and the service was good.  

Also, they do not have that spicy seasoning on the side, or the jar of pickled radish or pickled ginger on the table to add to your soup/entree as other places do.  Overall, it is ok, but not enough for me to return.

Me & the boyfriend have been eating here since day one and we love it! Love their curry katsu & ramen. And when you ask for extra of something they actually give you EXTRA. 

The owner is always nice & finds time to stop by our table to say hi. We've never had a problem with service here. 

This will always be one of our regular spots.
Best Ramen in Vegas ! I love the service- so nice. The iced green tea is AMAZING. My favourite is spicy tonkatsu ramen :) Also love the octopus balls and gyoza ! Going there today- Yum !

This is a small hidden gem that I found thanks to all the Yelp reviews! Located at the small strip where District One, Hachi and many other popular eateries.

My mom and I came in today around noon. It's a small restaurant and I recommend coming in early.  

We waited a couple minutes and were seated. There was only one server but I have to say, she was very lively and attentive. We ordered and it only took a few minutes to get our food. 

We ordered Chasiu Bowl from the regular menu and Tonkatsu Shoyu medium spicy from the Special menu.

Tonkotsu Shoyu is spicy and had sliced pork in a delicious rich, flavorful and slightly creamy broth. . The noodles itself were delicious -- perfectly cooked with the perfect amount of chew.

My mom enjoyed the rice bowl, Chasiu Bowl. It has tender ground pork, seaweeds and rice.

The portion looked small but in the end we had leftovers! The price is so reasonable, cost like $15 for two dishes. I can't wait to go back.
Always eat here with my hubby, cold noodles is in season, I like the yuzu soyo cold noodle. Really refreshing.

First, their music is terrible...it sounded like meth addicts banging on pots and pans! 
Next, their service was OK. The place was half empty and we still waited with empty drink glasses on multiple occasions. 

On to the important part...THE FOOD! 

I have to admit I used my buddy Philip T's review to adjust my dining choices! (I trust his reviews)

My GF and I both got the Tonkatsu with garlic chips, the thick noodles, extra chasu pork and some spicy sauce. 

I found everything to be enjoyable, but honestly it will be hard to get me back here! Ramen Sora and Hiromaru both have a much better Tonkatsu, so it will be tough to convince me to come back! 

I would give their food 3.5 stars, but the shitty music and poor service was enough to put them at 3 stars.

This place is simply amazing. I am a huge fan of ramen and this place does not disappoint. They have Tonkatsu, Shoyu and Miso ramen just to name a few. I had the Tonkatsu and it was just amazing. The Shoyu ramen broth is a bit thinner and more mild than the Tonkatsu, so make sure and have a good idea of what you want when you come here. The pork in the ramen was very flavorful and tasty. You can add things like corn and extra additions if you like as well. We also had the dumplings and they were amazing.

The service was fantastic and the people working there could not have been nicer. 

I will definitely be coming back here in the future. There are a ton of ramen places in this area, but this is one of the best.

Highly recommended!
Fantastic!! I ordered tonkatsu shoyu- very rich and tasty broth!! Wife ordered shio and she enjoyed it very much! The pork dumplings were amazing!!!
Excelent service and delicious ramen the waitress was so nice and the ramen was the best I've tried so far. Craving it already. Can't wait to go again.

The service was friendly and there was no wait for a table on a Thursday at 6pm but the ramen itself was just okay. 

I feel like the ramen broth needed more flavor and I think it's odd that they don't have bamboo shoots in their ramen or to order on the side. I had also ordered some tonkatsu curry and the tonkatsu though tender was a little overfried. 

If you're looking for a quick bite of ramen and don't have time to wait at some of the other ramen joints in Chinatown this might be the place to go.

Date & Time: Wednesday 3/3/15 @ 1:30pm

I've wanted to try a new ramen place, since Monta is always packed and has wait times over 45mins. I found this place with the help of some yelpers. I decided I can't go wrong with a place that offers ramen and appetizers.

I ordered:
- Takoyaki
- Tonkatsu
- 1 Soyu Ramen (garlic chips and extra chasiu)
- 1 Tonkatsu Ramen (extra chasiu and corn)
- 3 Calpico drinks
- 1 Sprite
total about $40

Since i've only tried Monta and (my moms ramen), I'll be comparing the two (mom already wins). 

I LOVE takoyaki and this place makes it so good, it's crisp on the outside and nice and creamy on the inside. The tonkatsu made with a cabbage salad and the tonkatsu sauce on the side, which was cooked to perfection. The tonkatsu was thick and crispy on the outside with the tender juicy pork on the inside. It was delicious.

When the ramen arrived the noodles were perfect, the soup was super flavorful and didn't need to add additional salt or soy sauce to it. Compared to monta's chasiu, this one is meaty in the middle and melt in your mouth on the sides (which is how it's suppose to be). I didn't enjoy the chasiu at Monta because it was like eating boiled fat (it was slippery, melty, and gooey). 

If you want incredible ramen, come here. The waitress was super friendly and helpful. This small ramen restaurant should be deemed the best. The best thing is, it didn't make my love sick, he got so sick at Monta, he was scared to try Ramen again.

Horrible service!! Didn't even get to try the food. Was given menus and ignored for almost 10 minutes without water or drinks offered then the waitress takes the order of customers that had just sat down!! We got up and left. On to the next ramen place!
The atmosphere was warm. They were very useful. The food was delicious! This was recommended to friends who say that this is the only place where she goes to Ramen.

Bf and I found our new ramen spot!!!
We got a delicious meal last night and shared the restaurant with only 2 others. I got the miso ramen and my man got the tonkatsu-shoyu. I asked that the charsui be replaced with kakurage (don't eat meat) and they happily obliged :D we got the edamame to start and put some of their spicy sesame oil and soy sauce on it, delicious and not over cooked.
The portions were PROPER and I couldn't recommend this place any higher! For Vday we tried Itsy Bitsy Ramen & Whiskey and were conned. The portions there were super small, so happy to have tried this place!
Ramen is good!! Not salty like Monta & Ramen Sora. Good service too. Will definitely come back for more. Plus i got a free drink just by checking in! Woohoo!!
First time here and definitely be back. Ramen had a great taste and service was fast even with just one server, she had a great happy energy.

This ramen spot has a wide selection of different ramen broths and toppings, which is really cool.  They had about 7 different types of broth and each broth had a different combination of toppings, so make sure you look at the toppings to see if your favorite thing is in there.  I ended up getting a shio ramen and added an egg and kikurage (my favorite topping of all time).  I had never had this type of broth before, and it was light and fresh.  It reminded me of the broth that comes in a Cup of Noodles, and I mean that in a good way because I love Cup of Noodles.  My husband got a tonkotsu broth which was really rich, thick, and creamy.  Ramen Tatsu is a good little ramen spot and offers a free soda with your Yelp check in!

I've been coming here since they opened 4-5 years ago and ever since then it's been my favorite spot for ramen..it's not oily like the other ramen places. If you like spicy I recommend the spicy miso, but you can pretty much order any ramen on the menu spicy. My son likes it simple so he gets the shoyu ramen with extra egg. The service is also fast and the waitresses are always super nice:)

This is our go-to spot for Ramen! This place never fails us and there's rarely a wait(maybe 1 time).  Portion is good, but you can add more for extra $. Service is awesome and fast. Everything we've tried has been delicious. Really surprised that this place isn't packed with lines, but maybe that's a good thing. Try it out.
One of the best veggie ramen in town.  I loved the broth.  Their portion is huge. I couldn't finish it. Will be coming back.
The Tonkatsu ramen and chasiu bowl was delicious. Service was great.  Will come back again.

Stopped by cause I was craving some Tsukemen (we don't have really anyone in Arizona that has this). When the meal came out my expectations were immediately met from a look standpoint. Pretty thick and flavorful broth and the noodles were nice and firm. The Chasu slices had a good amount of balance between fat and meat and once you placed it in the broth it instantly became a melt in your mouth texture.

The soft boiled egg was a little overdone but I'll forgive Ramen Tatsu just because it still tasted good. 

Overall, a great experience at Ramen Tatsu and the closest I can get to true Tsukemen.

Really good food,so far the best ramen I had i Las Vegas,the broth is perfect not fatty great taste!
Thank you I will come back for sure

I'm quite biased when it comes to ramen joints but I'm glad I came here, I didn't come here for the tonkotsu ramen giant, so i'll save that for another review. 
Ramen Tatsu exceeded my expectations,  they're the only place I know that serves Tsukemen ramen, this availability took my obsession for ramen to another level. If you're unfamiliar with Tsukemen Ramen, it's popularity has grown over the years, and one of the most notable concept of ramen as a regional style, is that it is undressed and the cold noodles are dipped into an accompanying bowl of fishy, undiluted broth before slurping. do not expect a traditional bowl of ramen swimming in a sea of broth. This makes for a great dish during the hot summer months of Las Vegas. I opted to add a few toppings to my noodles as well.
RT's sweet, spicy, citrusy broth clinging to extra-fat tsukemen noodles (Not udon) Has introduced to another dimension of ramen like no other, Move over everyone! Ramen tatsu's Tsukemen has staked its claim in the noodle ­pantheon of sin city. Have no mercy!

Beautiful setting and decor, really fair prices, delicious ramen and especially tasty chashu pork. The service was really great, we had a sweet ????? who served with a sing-song voice (I wish I loved anything as much as she seemed to love her work). Our table of three split an order of chicken karaage, three ramen bowls with some extra toppings (I got miso ramen), and a chashu rice bowl, and the bill came out to $14 a person (which simply does not happen in San Francisco where I'm from). The ramen was tasty, especially the two thick and fatty, cathartic chashu pieces in it, and the chashu bowl was elegant and delicious too. 

Basically, the food was on point, the interior is cute, and our server was like something from an anime. She even greets people in Japanese as they leave / enter. Can't be beat. ??????

Where their ramen falls a bit short (shoyu) compared to Monta's noodles, their side dishes ($3 happy hour prices too) edges it above Monta Chaya's efforts. Their karage is leagues better and bigger. The soup is fine but the initial toppings it comes with is a bit meager. The chasu pork slices are bigger here than other ramen joints, which is a definite plus. The noodles could use more work though. Everything here is served quickly and with a smile. Also still staffed primarily by Japanese. Will be coming back to try their tsukemen before placing a final verdict.

Tatsu Ramien was an excellent experience. The ambiance reminded me of Ramen Houses in Northern Japan. The staff is friendly, accommodating, and allowed me to knock the dust off of my conversational Japanese. 
The ramen was good to include the broth. I agree with most of the other reviews about the with of noodles. Make sure to specify the thickness you desire.  My wife and I found the "wide noodle" described on the menu not to be so "wide."  All of the menu choices for the night was well worth it and was served promptly, still hot, and with the friendlyness that we have grown accustomed to while in Japan.  
My wife and I enjoyed the meal with another couple. The total bill was under $70 dollars and we did not skimp on side dishes. We were all satiated, full, and satisfied. 
The environment can accommodate both quick meals for singular people as well as groups. I would also feel comfortable taking my children to the restaurant. 
Tatsu gets our "enthusiastic thums up."  Go check it out for yourselves!

I am a fan of chicken ramen and Tatsu did justice. If you are into lighter ramen with less salt and oil, go for the Shio that is made from chicken broth. I like a little yuzu refreshing taste in the soup. I wish the broth was a little hotter because the ramen turned cold quickly. The noodles were firm. I prefer the noodles a bit chewier and have more bite. Tatsu is generous with their portion and toppings. I added bean sprouts and kimchi on the side. It was such a steal for .77 cent for so much toppings.

I had high hopes for this joint, but fell short a bit...

Upon entering you may think looks similar to *onta, that's cuz the same contractor built it!  Ambiance looks good, smells good, tastes good, but needs a bit of color or pizazzz in the bowl.  I just don't feel the magic...  The green onions were the only vibrant add on in my spicy tonkatsu ramen.  The broth itself was good n porky, habanero infusion adds a kick to the tastebuds!  When it comes to any Japanese cuisine, I have come to expect the visual sensations as well as the palate sensations to come together in a harmonious combination of flavor and flair.  I know....sounds like a food snob but truth be told!  Imagine a California roll with no red crab, no green avo, just white rice n black seaweed, still look appetizing?  Back to the ramen, maybe add some red daikon? Shredded carrot? Cucumber leaf?  Fish cake swirly thing? An habanero slice? (no seeds!)  I'm no chef, but I know what looks and tastes good!  Ima give em another shot but on to the next...  *iromaru here I come

Try every Ramen joint in Vegas? 

Challenge accepted!!!!

Tanoshimu!

Ramen cravings in Vegas are never fully satisfied. Most of the ramen shops are comparable to one another - and by that, I mean either average or below average. The broths just don't cut it and the ingredients are always lacking. We tried Tatsu as an alternative to the jam-packed Sora and Monta and the results were about the same, except without the excessive wait times. The shoyu broth was nothing more than a glorified soy sauce base. The noodles and egg were decent enough, but the cuts of charsiu and lack of anything else was a let down. However, I would argue that there are a couple of benefits of getting your ramen fix at Tatsu. First, the ramen comes out pretty quick (almost too quick, which might explain some of the lacklusterness). Second, checking in on Yelp nets you a free soda. So, there you have it.

It was my first time dining here and I'm quiet surprised that we have a good ramen in vegas. I saw the review on yelp, the rating isn't that good, but thought of giving it a try and I was satisfied with the food. I ordered tonkotsu shoyu ramen. The broth and the noodle was delicious. I emptied my entire bowl without anything left. I definitely will come back again.

Recently I've been on a Las Vegas ramen binge the past couple weeks and I think this place is definitely one to visit. It's more spacious than Monta, which is where we usually go. 

The service was fantastic. She made sure to clear empty plates but not come around so much that she imposed. She was very polite and always made sure our drinks were filled. 

We visited 430 on a Wednesday and were pleasantly surprised to hear it was still happy hour. Some apps and asahi for $3 each, cant beat that.
I like how on the menu they describe the broth very well.

Shoyu ramen: the broth was well balanced and it wasn't too salty, but still had a light soy sauce flavor. This ramen comes with an egg which was a plus.

Tonkatsu shoyu ramen: basically a milkier version of the shoyu ramen. You can tell they really cooked it with bones so the flavors really come out. 

Takoyaki: a good balance of sauce on top. Usually I burn my tongue on this but it was nice that for once it was served at a temp that didn't hurt.

Small curry rice: served with a side of picked radishes. 'Nuff said.
----but on a real note, I was pretty stoked because I was craving curry and it was at the same standard if you went to just a Japanese curry place.

Gyoza: pretty standard but it felt like there was more than what restaurants usually serve.

All this plus an Asahi for $30. Not too shabby. I'll be back Ramen Tatsu.

I had never tried ramen before coming to Ramen Tatsu, and it was a great place to try it! I've since had dinner at Monta, and don't really understand the hype over there. It was good, but Ramen Tatsu had better prices, more comfortable seating, and better ramen (though I'm clearly no ramen connoisseur). 

I've tried the spicy miso and tonkatsu at Ramen Tatsu, and would recommend both! It's also really nice that you get a free drink for checking in!
Authentic Japanese Ramen. Great service and great ramen. I want to say the best Ramen in Town!!!!!
This is my favorite Ramen place in town, great service and they have awesome curry as well.

Great ramen, great gyoza, and fried rice was made me feel like go back Japan ! Waitress Emika was so great service and attentive ! Cute nice girl. Owner was very young nice dude also! I highly recomemded this ramen shop!!!!

Ramen Tatsu has become my go to place for Ramen. It's ramen matches the best in the city. Whether it's the Shoryu, or Tonkotsu, the broth it first rate. The noodles are perfectly cooked. It's relaxed. There's no line. The sides are first rate. The owners are really nice. What's not to love. There are other places I go for something particular they offer, but when it's just about a relaxed nice bowl of ramen, you can't do better than here.
I understand there can be a line, but I've not hit it.

I'm Asian.  I'm from Hawaii.  I eat a lot of ramen.  And this is GOOD ramen.  All in good fun and no harm meant...

This really is great noodles and pork broth. I hear the owner brings in Sun noodles from Hawaii.  The ramen noodle is thin, soft yet firm, holds its own taste while holding the flavor of the broth very well.  The broth is rich and flavorful.

 I've had the spicy miso ramen, chicken curry, spicy tonkatsu ramen, and tsukemen.  All, very lovely.  I don't say this too often while traveling, this is a must eat if you are looking for ramen worth eating.  

Service is well done.  They were very accommodating with us, a large group filled with hungry children.  Food was brought out quickly.  Its a tiny place, yet provides a comforting and welcoming ambiance.

I know there are a lot of ramen places to choose from in Vegas but we specifically were craving tsukemen because I'm all about that dippin' ramen life. If I can just find and review ramen restaurants that serves tsukemen all day every day, that would be awesome.

The service was quick and we were seated right away at the bar. The waitress explained the levels of spiciness to us since we were intrigued. My husband ordered a spicy tsukemen while I ordered it in a mild spiciness. The original basic tsukemen is not spicy at all.

Mild was actually spicier than I thought but still good. However, right away, I noticed the noodles aren't like your usual tsukemen noodle. They just seemed like regular cold cooked ramen noodle? I'm used to the tsukemen noodles being incredibly chewy and chunkier. The tsukemen came with two slices of pork, a seaweed and two soft boiled eggs. No frills and bells and whistles here. 

The broth was good, but much saltier than I anticipated. I did enjoy the flavor, but was overwhelmed by how salty it was. I know that tsukemen broth is supposed to be very rich but I was definitely saltier than I usually like. Nonetheless, this place did help satisfy the tsukemen itch we had been having.

I'm half Japanese and I know good Ramen when I taste it! This place is authentic and the atmosphere is very welcoming. I always go with my mom (who is from Japan) and she loves this place!!! We always get the same thing Tonkatsu, Spicy Miso Ramen, Takoyaki, and Gyoza.  Go and try this place before everyone finds out how good it is.

This was the second time I've been to this place and it's my new ramen joint. The first time I came was on a Tuesday before work and it was literally empty except for the hostess who was really polite. I just sat and used the Yelp check in offer for a free soda. I ordered the spicy ramen with pork bone marrow. It was delicious. After I finished my soda I just asked for water because it's $1.50 per soda can with no refills (which is kinda a bummer) other than that, it's a nice decor and it's a nice place. The ramen is really tasty and it's fulfilling. I will always be back!

X marks the spot when it comes to good service, here at Ramen Tatsu. I arrived at opening time this past Sunday (02/12 at 11:30), and was greeted by a young, very bright and enthusiastic female server, who told me I could sit anywhere; I chose the booth closest to the door. 

She immediately placed a full water glass and menu on my table, then went about some other duties. When I was ready to order she magically appeared and efficiently took my order, repeated it back to me for confirmation and whisked away to the back with my menu in tow. All the while, more customers were filing in to the place, and she didn't miss a beat with any of them. 

In good time, she returned with a steaming bowl of miso ramen and a small plate of chahan (I chose regular fried rice over kimchi fried rice). The chahan was decent, with a nice bit of wok flavor (I dropped the left over chahan at my mother's, and she thought it was excellent), and the miso ramen was just what I needed after a couple days of hard driving. The broth was hot, flavorful, with firm noodles, plenty of bean sprouts, corn, green onion and chasshuu. While it wasn't as good as a bowl of Misoya Tomi's miso ramen (they're actually closed now), it was pretty dang good. The highlight of the dish was the chasshuu, with excellent flavor in the lean part, and of course, a lot of flavor on the fatty part, which was plentiful. 

After drinking the bowl dry, I pushed the bowl away and almost immediately after, the server dropped the check at my table, and asked me if I wanted a box for the left overs. When she returned with the box, she parted with a warm/polite "thank you". 

The industry needs more servers like her. I hope this server, and many more like her, decide to make it their role in life to do this job, and do it well - especially in small, hole-in-the-wall places like Ramen Tatsu. Who knows, maybe she's the owner, and if so, thank God.

This place is just a bit off the main China town area and there's no waiting line. We all ordered the Shoyu ramen and it's perfect for me and it is cheap also. The broth is just right, the meat just melts in your mouth and the egg is yummy. I wish there'll be some beansprout though. The service is nice and quick. Nice place for a ramen that doesn't have to wait for long line.
This place was amazing! It was my first time here and the staff was super nice with helping me pick out yummy food to eat! Will be coming back for sure!

- I like this place even more than I like Monta Ramen.
- The broths for their different types of ramen are all delicious!
- Their ramen also comes with a good amount of complimentary garnishes (different types of ramen come with a different set of garnishes).
- I also like their fried rice.
- Each table has 3 different sauce bottles so that you can make your own dipping sauce.
- Their gyoza is pan fried, not deep fried (I like deep fried better).
- Their soft drinks are in a can, as opposed to a soda machine, so no free refills.
- We're always seated right away. 
- And it's not claustrophobic like at Monta Ramen.
- Servers are fast, friendly, and attentive.
- They have happy hour for food as well as drinks.
- This is my new favorite ramen place!

After my wife and I were disappointed during our last visit at Monta (Food was still good. Service sucked), we've been looking for a replacement spot and I can confidently say that this place fit the bill. The ramen was delicious and savory not to mention that they have all of the popular appetizers. They also have happy hour which is definitely a win if you're looking for a spot to decompress after work. We will definitely be coming back to this spot as regulars from now on. Hopefully it doesn't get too crowded.

So my favorite spot Misoya closed down and idk why but I heard it failed an inspection? Anyways 

This place had high ratings so I brought my ramen partner and drove here. 4.5 stars? Can't go wrong! The interior was very appealing with lots of Christmas decorations for the season. There was one floor person who was seating and serving at least 20 people. Kudos to her.

This ramen spot is in a very busy plaza outside of China town that includes J Karaoke, Chada Thai, District 1, and Chinese BBQ AKA parking sucks on the weekend.

Their menu includes more than just ramen: appetizers, curry, and other Japanese dishes. 

I got their karaage and gyoza to start and for my ramen I chose their deluxe ramen with all the fixings. At $10.99 it was a very reasonable price. This includes 3 slices of chashu, corn, cabbage, and some sort of fungus. Basically I didn't dig the broth. I haven't been to many ramen places to compare: Fukumimi, Monta, Misoya, And Jimya. Personally it just didn't have as much flavor and it just didn't taste good to me. I can see it appealing to certain people but my idea of ramen was not this. The chashu was flavorful, but not fall apart delicious.

As a saving grace their gyoza was extremely delicious. This was a stand out for me. The karaage was pretty good too but nothing to write home about. 

Service was okay/sweet, prices are about the same as everywhere, space/environment was nice, but ramen was just okay.  I would return to try a non-ramen dish, but I'm not in a hurry.

Absolutely delicious! We order quite a few items as I'm just getting home from the hospital and wanted food test to eat in the house. My God that fried rice! I'm in love with it! Perfect for take out not much as far as seating or environment. The service was exceptional! Prices are to low for the food!! Great curry and excellent ramen! I ate myself silly! I highly recommend ordering yourself some take out of your in the area.

*sigh*  That was soo good!

First time having Tsukemen Ramen and i really enjoyed it.  I asked the server what's their specialty and was kindly steered to this offering.  It's basically a combination of seafood (mackerel) and pork broth.  Those of you with shellfish allergy don't fret.  You're good, brAh!  

The noodles and soup are served in separate bowls, but it is entirely up to you if you want to marry them, or be a dipper.  Have at it.  I personally recommend being a dipper because well.. it's funner!  Food just taste better when the tone is right.  Whatever it is you choose to do, don't fuck it up. I'd hate to watch you enjoy your second serving!

On its own the stock can be really dense, but perfect when pair with the noodles.  Try not to grab too much noodles as it will really pick up on the intensity of the broth.  Loads of scallions are thrown in the clump of grains and topped off with 2 piece of char-siu, a lemon wedge, and a single strip of nori.  The soup is served NOT hot, yet it is warmer than warm.  A little squeeze of lemon over the noodles and this dish actually became quite refreshing in a way.  Sodium overload?? Ain't nobody got time for that!

If you're a fan of the soba zaru (cold buckwheat noodles) then i think you'll really like Tsukemen Ramen here.

Seared Pork belly was meaty and delish!  Would order again.  Gyoza however was alright.

+1 for GOOD air circulation  

*cliff* How do i come about acquiring a stamp card??
Pleasant surprise! Fast service and good ramen.

Came here to try the tsukemen ramen and I loved it! Fishy, salty, intense broth to dip your thick ramen noodles in! It was my first time trying this type of ramen since I've already tried all the other ramen places in town (Monta, Sora) and I would definitely come back to have tsukemen again! They have the regular order for $10.77 and a double noodle order for $12.77. I got the regular order and when I finished my noodles and still had plenty of broth left I regretted not doing the double noodles order :( the broth was so good, I really wanted to sip on it but alas it's too salty without the noodles.  The charsiu that accompanied it was soft and delicious.

We also ordered the kaarage and it was seasoned just right, crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside. The mister had the miso ramen with butter and he devoured his bowl. He also complimented on how great the charsiu was! He also finished the broth in his bowl so that says something since he's normally not a soup person!

They also serve green tea (iced or hot), that does not come out of a can and you get free refills.

Overall we had a great lunch! Would definitely return!
Quick and fast!  The broth (dashi) is very good!  Always come off the plane to have a meal here!

I have been there 3 times, and every time it was just outstanding!  Love there happy hour pupu menus which is great!  The takoyaki melts in your mouth, the gyoza is outstanding, and their Japanese style char siu is the BOMB!   Soooooo tender and melts in your mouth.  Of course their ramen is excellent and I just love their curry!  One of my best place to dine!

The spicy ramen was out of this world
One of the best I ever had. The place is cozy but nice. Appetizers were pretty good too. Price is very reasonable. Definitely we will be back soon. Service was very nice and quick.

Absolutely love this place and it is packed out the door today. Best place ever to celebrate my friend Casey's birthday. Always treated above and beyond by staff. Nicest people ever. The food is the best in Vegas if you love Ramen.

Great service and great food! Feels more authentic in here rather than somewhere like jinya. Even our server was Japanese and spoke Japanese. 
Broth was definitely more spicy than other places. My boyfriend always gets the most spicy one, but here at Ramen Tatsu it was a little too spicy for him. It all tasted delicious though. 
Takoyaki HH was yummy too, but I wouldnt recommend the karaage. It was average. 
We will be returning for the ramen!:)

This is now my favorite ramen spot in town! Service and food 5 stars. The best part is their happy hour, which is from 3-6 pm and everything (that i like) is $3! Their seared Chashu is the BEST thing ever along with their katsu curry bowl! Their spicy miso is absolutely to die for as well, considering they use habanero, it is spicier than most spicy ramens in town, but tastes better than them all. I can't speak highly enough about them and i have tried almost every ramen spot in town now. I still don't know how Monta has the reputation it has when this place poops all over them.

I really like this place for a fairly traditional bowl of ramen.  It is high quality and tasty.  If you like it spicy they have some pretty insane levels of spice available.  Not my thing but my friend had some.  We were seated quickly and the service was pretty good.  The egg in my ramen was cold but did heat up after a little bit.  The flavors were spot on.  I wish that they had more options outside the basics.  Some places call them Fusion Ramen.  Well worth coming to as it doesn't seem to have the wait list problems of other places but the food is just as good.

Ramen was really good. The Gyoza was okay nothing amazing. The squid was surprisingly delicious. We never had it before. The chicken Katsu that came with the curry was really crispy. I have to say it's much better than Japanese curry zens chicken Katsu. 
The service was great. Our server was really friendly and understanding. 
If you check in at this location on yelp, you will get a free drink. I got green tea :) 
There is no line like Monta ramen. The prices are slightly a lil bit more than Monta but it's worth going here if you don't wanna wait in that long line at Monta.

Awesome Tonkatsu and Shoyu ramen! Make sure to try the pork cutlet, gyoza and fried chicken! Fried garlic chips and seasoned egg are a must. The chasiu is flavorful but sometimes a little too fatty for my taste.

Reasonably priced, if you get shut out at Sora or Monta, this spot is the next logical choice if you are a ramenista!
Service was great and the curry Ramen and spicy miso were excellent. Will definitely come back
I love this place for Ramen. Never have to wait for a table, excellent service and the ramen is amazing. I like that they have a spicy option you can add to any style ramen bowl.

There is a first for everything  .... Ramen Tatsu has not disappointed my family and friends .... service and food are very consistent  .... 

If you find yourself in California  .... Puente Hills area .... look up Tamaya ..... very similar  ......

If you guys ever to eat real ramen, don't ever go here, the noodles don't cook well, like half cooked, I was kinda hungry when I went to place, it made me have no appetite after I tried it... My friend was like.. I would never go here again.! And don't order teriyaki which is totally terrible.

From the moment we walked in - I loved this place. Comparing it to other ramen spots around town, isn't a real comparison because this is Tatsu.. and Tatsu is a comfy spot with really good food and a cozy atmosphere. 

We will be back - and often. Thanks for having a 30 minute wait at the place we went prior to Tatsu - it made me happy to try another when the afore mentioned place,  always gives less than stellar service and haphazard presentations.

Tatsu tastes home made and well crafted. Go there. 

P.S. As a reminder .. just because you don't like something - does not mean that "it isn't good" Another recent review mentions that "ramen isn't his thing' so he gives the place 1 star. Seems legit. 

Tatsu is worth your visit. it's really good. 

Happy Eating!
I just love the soup and the thin noodles! The service is good and the Japanese interior decoration is exotic. So far this is my favorite ramen store!

Our first time and was amazingly good and very tasteful. The broth is well seasoned and loved the noodles. We ordered extra noodles, it was that good!! Would recommend the place if you're craving for Japanese ramen.

Man that bowl looks good when it comes out. But the broth is bland, the meat is just over salted, and nothing else is good. I don't think its a good thing when I have to try and fill the bowl with chili oil and soy sauce to get flavor.

Service is fast, friendly, but the food is lacking.

Monta, Fukumimi are better choices.

Love this ramen spot! They have the spicy options that are perfect for all spicy lovers. You can make any ramen spicy. There are six levels of spicy. They go up to Jigoku "Hell" Level 3. Wonderful housemade paste with ghost chili peppers and habanero! You can also choose to add additional toppings. Yum! I love customization. The gyoza is tasty, as well. I highly recommend this place! Legit!
Fantastic ramen! Highly recommend adding spice for 50 cents. Sake is cheap & you get a lot

This has become my favorite ramen spot in Vegas. 

Items tried & liked (so far): 
Miso Ramen
Spicy Miso Ramen
Curry Ramen
Katsu Curry
Tonkatsu
Kimchi & Regular Fried Rice
Gyoza
Takoyaki


Restaurant is clean. Service is quick & friendly. The two ladies who work the front are A++++ 

Everyone that we have taken here or recommend it to love it here :)

Haven't tried the ramen here, but the Katsu curry is great! Very flavorful just like the curry I have had in Japan! I'll be sure to try the ramen on my next visit, but if you're a fan of Japanese curry dishes, this is one restaurnt to check out to satisfy your curry cravings.
