Smartly designed, low key authentic ramen joint. The food was filling and decently priced. Service was quick and courteous. The green tea cheesecake was definitely matcha, and delicious. I liked it a lot, definitely a established joint that can hold its own in the district.

This review is way overdue, my apologies for waiting so long!!! this is by far my FAVORITE ramen place in town, why? because they have the BEST SERVICE! I'm all about great service, this little Japanese lady who worked there always greeted you with the cutest smile and attentive service.  I can't count how many times I was having a really bad day, but her positive attitude always influenced me, not to mention they are super easy going when it comes to customize the soup.  I can tell them I want my soup less salty, and she'll say "ok no problem", had it been another ramen restaurant (whose name start with "Sxxa" or "Mxxxxa"), they will give me a funny look as if I'm trying to make their job difficult.  Their ramen are super yummy too (probably because I customize the soup exactly the way I wanted), NOT once I had a bad service from here.  Some of my favorites are Karaage (fried chicken), Shio and Miso Ramen, today I just tried their spicy pork ramen, watch out on that one, they are not joking about "spicy" part, but it's soooo good :)  Thank you for the awesome service Ramen Tatsu!
This is my favorite place to get ramen  The atmosphere is always nice and it's not so busy like other places. It really is a hidden gem

Its good to see that Las Vegas is finally getting a good selection of ramen houses. Ramen Tatsu was recommended by a friend who frequents this place and I have to agree that they offer one of the better tasting ramens in Vegas. The ramen shop is quaint, tightly packed (just like most authentic Japanese ramen houses), and run by very pleasant people. We ordered the spicy tonkotsu, shoyu ramen, takoyaki and kimchi rice and weren't disappointed by the flavors and serving portions. The ramen noodles were cooked perfectly, not soggy nor was it undercooked. The broths were delicious and had very satisfying umami flavorfs. If I had any gripe it would just be the smaller than usual sized takoyakis, which had tastiness that made up for the lack of portions. I'm sure me and wifey will now include this spot as part of our ramen rotations, especially now that our usual go-to places are always packed to the brim. But make no mistake, Ramen Tatsu isn't just a substitute ramen place, it's now a must-eat there place!

I've tried this place twice in August....yes this review has been overdue and now they are currently closed for site maintenance! 

I actually liked this place.  The tonkatsu broth was tasty and the ramen was cooked al dente. The bad side was that there were only two pieces of pork and I was left still feeling hungry.  I guess I must have been starving or I just need a side of extra noodles.  Overall, I liked Tatsu ramen and I'm hoping they reopen soon. There is a minimum for credit cards so bring cash if your only ordering one bowl!

Always found this place a little salty, however, on my last visit for a dinner on a Monday, I asked the waitress to make my broth less salty; and the result was great. The broth did lose some taste to it since it seems like they just added water instead of balancing the seasoning, it ended up being perfect for me. They seem to be a different style of ramen than to Sora's Sapporo style, yet they are pretty good for the price that they offer. I do like sora the best still, but their tonkotsu ramen is yummy as they make sure you get enough kikugage and green onions. Their chasui bowl is just average, so you can probably skip this one.

decide to come here after reading the reviews. place is very clean and staff is friendly. as for the food... eh. I got the deluxe and my friend had the spicy miso. the broth was just okay. it lacked depth and a bit of flavor. ramen does come with excess amount of chirasu and other things to fill up the bowl. the thick noodle was let anything memorable. also ordered goyza and kiraage. goyza was whatevers but kiraage was above average. not too crispy and very juicy inside. I wanted to try the fried rice based on the reviews but didn't have room for it. overall, I don't know if I would come back here. I still prefer ramen sora as my number 1 ramen place followed by Monta ramen. it wasn't bad but not really worth going back.

Really good ramen, lots of options -- thick or thin noodles, various types of broth, etc.  Nice happy hour discounts, and they have the brick ice cream macarons as well.  A great lunch option, or a light dinner.

We've found another favorite ramen place!
We started with appetizers: the Japanese kimchi ( which was more vinegary than the Korean kimchis I've tried),  goes very well with the smoky seared chashu.
Their takoyaki comes in 4 pieces. Most of the takoyakis I've tried in other places have raw dough taste, but the ones here are  flavorful, crunchy on the outside and deliciously creamy inside, I highly recommend this. 
The karaage is crispy, and even though it's fried, it's not greasy at all. The greens and refreshing  dressing that come with it complement the takoyaki & the karaage.
My companion had the Shoyu ramen. The chicken broth was tasty. The egg was cooked well. The noodles were chewy in a good way. The chashu pork was buttery with just the right amount of fat. 
I had the Tonkotsu ramen,which has a delicious smoky broth. It also comes with melts in your mouth chashu. Their ramen servings are huge.  Good enough for 2 people.

Service is fast and efficient. Servers are nice and friendly. Place is clean and inviting. My only wish is that they change the piped in music which rendered horrendous covers of pop music from the likes of Alicia Keys and Colbie Caillat. Other than that, this place is highly recommended. Will definitely be back. :)
This is my go to for Ramen!!! The prices are just as great as the food!!! Some places you get what you pay for. But not here!!! You get MORE!!! Flavor is always on point! Sooo worth the wait!!!

Absolutely a great Ramen place in the Spring Mountain area. Parking can be a bit difficult in a crowded strip mall. But it's well worth it for the Spicy Miso. 

There has never been a long wait. Service is quick and friendly. Asahi drafts are cheap and you better order the kimchee for an appetizer. 

Every time I go I think that I will try something new. But every time the amazing Spicy Miso calls my name and I dig into a delicious bowl of awesomeness.

My FAVORITE ramen place in Vegas. I usually get the deluxe ramen because I like lots of toppings. Their habanero spice add in is delicious, and actually spicy! I've been going for years and it is consistently good.

Poppin' ramen spot without waiting a "million hours"!!! :) Not a big difference from other Ramen places that I've tried, however this place is not extremely packed, they have a good selection of ramen, its very good and staff is great. Cool Japanese relaxed ambiance.

small but oh so worth it!! its in the small area of jones/sping mt., by Cafe Moda. limited parking. Any time my fiancé has taken me its been on a fri/sat around 8pm, so i have yet to see the "late crowd". if we ever go around 11 its been during the week. but we have seen families, groups of friends and couples. 
Annnnyway....staff is very very attentive and fast.

 l have been to a few katsu curry places, and ramen places. this place is amazing. the tankatsu curry chicken is so dang crunchy its rediculous!!! and the gyozo is the bomb! you can make your own dipping sauce with vinegar and soy sauce on table and its just fine. the curry is thick, dark brown like gravy....yuuuummmy!!!! Rice is sticky, and they give you a LOT. they have specials, so thats great for us! My fiancé gets the ramen and always orders a side of noodles for like, a dollar...and always, always regrets it...they give you a huge bowl, full of the greatest ramen noodles ever :) he always eats the food i have left on my plate,cuz i get full quick. but this little white girlie doesnt have much left for him here! i eats it allll!! haha!! The ramen bowl i think he gets is called Delux. he really likes it, and he's filipino, always getting me to try different places. 

beer selection and prices are good, have specials too. 

only reason i havent given 5 stars is because i actually haven't tried a ramen bowl...yet. ;)

Great little local spot. Most authentic out of all the Japanese style ramen spots that are in the valley. I love how they offer true Japanese appetizers and sides. The way they boil their ramen is just like the way they do back home. Def my comfort food spot to be at when my friends are in town I love taking them here. They even offer cold ramen! Oishii

didnt really dine-in, but we did a take out coz hubby was tired. the food wasnt to bad. compared to ramen sora, tatsu's miso soup has more flavor and when you ask for spicy, man is it spicy...flavor spicy, how i like it... not Hot spicy. i cannt remeber what else i ordered but other than that its a kute place to go.

Awesome authentic ramen with very friendly service at an affordable price. I've tried their tsukemen which was glorious and their tonkatsu ramen which was alright. Their chicken karage also uses high quality big chunks of meat. For the tsukemen I recommend adding extra scallions and the garlic chips for flavor but the dipping sauce is already awesome by itself. They also have some great little art designs on their wall. Highly recommend!

This place is fantastic! If you love noodles, check it out - you can find every amazing Asian broth flavor in a bowl, with enough noodles to fill you, and if you want more... $1.50 for a full noodle refill!

Super rude staff. I guess you have to be Asian to be seated. There were tons of open seats and the staff said it'd be a fire Hazard to seat us cause 5 of us would be too many people. We left and went to Korean Bistro in the same plaza...... WAY BETTER CHOICE!!! Thanks Ramen Tatsu staff for being so rude to us.
I came back for 2nd times. This time, food was excellent,5/5. Fast serve 5/5. Tasty 5/5. Service was great! 5/5. I'm coming back again....

Came  here on my last night in Vegas and we had the fried chicken and also got a bowl of Miso Ramen. Flavor was on point for both. 

The fried chicken does not come with mayo so as for a little side of it, it is perfect with the chicken!

Ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen (only one with thin noodles), Gyoza, Karaage with a side salad. All good flavors and very attentive food service! Yes I have tried a lot of other Ramen places I won't mention because they are all good in their own right. Easily one of the best Ramen and prices very competitive especially in happy hour (3-6). Very clean restaurant and nicer than most, good food with very good table manners and service will have my recommendations anytime.

I went here for the first time with friends during our lunch break.

The place itself is very clean and the decor of the restaurant is very well done. When we got to Ramen Tatsu, there was a nice Japanese lady sweeping the front. We asked if they were open and she cheerfully said yes.

We walked in and we were the only customers here. By the time we left, however, more people came.

I ordered to tonkotsu shoyu ramen along with one of my friends. They cost $7.77. The other friend got the spicy miso, which was slightly pricier at a little over $8.

The same lady we saw sweeping the front also got us our drinks and took our order. She was really friendly, smiled a lot, and even took our picture for us.

Shame on me for forgetting to take a picture of my bowl of ramen, but it looked so good. I couldn't stop myself from digging right in.

The broth was tasty and had just the right amount of saltiness. The noodles were good as well. I just wish there was more pork. 2 slices isn't enough for such a big serving of ramen.

I'm adding Ramen Tatsu to my list of ramen spots. I like it even more because it seems it's owned and run by a family.

Ok... I am not a big fan of Vegas but found my self going there more often than i'd like to, for my hubby works trip. So we found this little gem in the middle of chinatown vegas. The building was so small and nothing fancy about it till we got inside and found ourselves welcomed with typical warm japanase family owned restaurant. Truly reminded us of Being in Japan. And i tried their spicy miso ramen which was totemo oishii desu!! The first ramen place in US that took me back to the little ramen shop in sapporo!! So thrilled that i finaly get the flavor that i hVe been craving for. The broth is very rich with flavor and yes its spicy!! My husband tried their curry... Which was delish and authentic. And oh did i mention about their Karaage??? Must try item on the menu! Glad that Now i have a reason to be excited About if vegas come to our trip radar!
Great food, great service, food comes out very fast and I loved how the server spoke to me in Japanese as soon as she realized we were Japanese. Definitely coming back again :)
Authentic Japanese ramen place! I'd say it's best in Las Vegas. I wish katsu came with the curry & rice. However, still the best!

Accidentally visit here since my boyfriend favorite spot next door Asian BBQ noodle was closed. 

My boyfriend ordered a miso ramen, he's thought its was average. The service was friendly and helpful

Excellent tasting ramen is served here. Service is prompt and generally courteous. What's even better is that you won't have to wait too long to get a seat unlike some other places in town. Maybe I shouldn't say this; but I hope this place doesn't get too popular.
Thank you yelp reviewers for helping me find this wonderful little ramen shop! Attentive service, fair prices, and most importantly, delicious ramen.

This place is going to be our go to whenever we're in Vegas! Came here the day after EDC
Spicy ramen is the best hangover cure 
Their Ramen is on point and there was no wait.
I miss it already):

Always love coming to this place. Their ramen is good an a reasonable price, but their pork katsu curry is to die for and such a good price for a large amount! My absolute favorite. Everyone is always so nice and welcoming.

This is probably going to be my new favorite spot. First time here and I already enjoy the vibe. It's small spot but not a hole in the wall like Monta.The minute we came in the waitress greeted us and sat us down. She gave us the menu, took our drink and appetizer order and came out less than than a minute later. Yup, that was quick. She was pleasant, friendly and smiled throughout the whole service plus explained the menu to us which is a plus. 

We ordered gyoza, chasu ramen, seared chasu plate with kimchee and fried rice and the Katsu curry plate.  All portions were perfect. Not too small nor too big. I had the katsu curry plate and it was delish! It was just as good as Zen's curry ( my favorite Japanese curry spot). The curry was pleasantly spicy but not too much. 

After eating, my party stayed a but longer just to chat it up and the awesome part was that no one rushed us to get up and refilled our drinks at least two times even when the restaurant started to get overly packed. If it weren't for that, I would've given this place four stars. I like this place a lot and will be back soon to try their ramen.

I gotta give props to my boyfriend on this one for finding this little gem. It's located in a little strip mall  on Jones right next to Chubby Cattle. Once you walk in it's very small and quaint, but I liked it. You can tell it's a cozy, little business. The service was outstanding. Super attentive and very helpful with answering any questions. 

When it came down to eating I decided to try the tonkotsu soyu ramen with egg added. The noddles arrived quickly, hot & fresh. I really enjoyed the flavor of the broth and thought all the toppings were equallevenly distributed. I did have to ask for hot sauce to add a bit more spice, but overall it was very tasty. 

I'll definitely be back here again soon. Their happy hour specials looked awesome too!

This is becoming our favorite ramen place in Las Vegas. 
I have been to Japan at least six times and grew up with Japanese food. This place taste really, really close to Japan! I think their food is really authentic. Everything is delicious! We love it here!
We tried their shoyu ramen, tonkotsu ramen, fried rice, gyoza, takoyaki, karaage chicken, & shrimp shumai. We're going to keep coming back and try more! 
Their place is small, but the service is fast and friendly. We order our food, eat, and go.

If you love ramen... come here! It is so delicious! I had the Spicy Miso Ramen. It is super spicy, my tolerance is maybe a 4 out of 10 and this to me was around 9. Spicy but the flavor was on point. Only place I get ramen!

Having gone a few times, I was a bit disappointed at the last two visits. They really need to hire at least one more waitress/waiter. They only have one waiting on all tables and greeting customers to their table. Because of this, service is super slow. You have to wait quite some time to be seated (they don't clean right away after someone leaves), some time for them to take your order, and some time to get your check.  For that -1 star.  With this restaurant being busy and popular especially in this plaza, it would be helpful if they could have one more person working. 

The last visit, the meat and egg really disappointed me. The meat was chewy and not tender and was filled with fat and skin instead of meat.  The soft boiled egg was a bit over cooked as you can see from the yolk. The spoon had black marks on it and was dirty. For that -1 Star. 

For something I initially enjoyed and would've given 5 stars, I was quite disappointed in my last two visits. Nonetheless I will return and hope to see improvements.

Two visits in two days. That says something!
Came here and had the tonkotsu ramen. Amazing! The broth is better than any place I've been in LA. Rich and full of flavor. 
His chashu is unbelievable. Braised and seared, it's a must try.
The gyoza are mini size, but pack a wallop of flavor.
Karaage chicken come out in huge pieces, very moist with a great crunch. 
His cold ramen with dipping sauces is fantastic, especially the sesame dipping sauce. And it's presented exquisitely. 
Asahi on draft is a huge plus!
Expect gracious hospitality, and amazing service. 
This is now on my "must list" each time I visit Vegas!

I don't really have much to say about this place except that it was mediocre. 

I ordered the tonkotsu shoyu and it was average. My boyfriend ordered the katsu curry and it tasted below average. He ordered it knowing it wasn't going to taste authentic because he's not a big fan of ramen, so he didn't have much to choose from. 

Don't get me started on the takoyaki lol.

The reason for the low stars is because of service. We didn't get approached till 10-15 minutes after we sat down. 

On the plus side, I think it's cool that they have more options (like curry) that any other ramen place I've been to. 

I probably won't visit again since they have so much competition around them, which I have yet to try.

I wish they were open later!!!  Granted I shouldn't be eating so late in the first place to anger my stupid acid reflux, but as an industry person in Las Vegas, you sometimes just want late night ramen after a stressful shift. Am I right or am I right??  

    Now back to business..., LOVE this place!! Hands down the most beautifully flavored Tonkatsu broth in town in my humble opinion. That along with the fantastic service by the friendly wait staff makes it just that more perfect. For you gym rats on a carb loading day, have a small bowl of their curry rice with your ramen bowl and you..are...set!! Oh and the Chasu pork on that ramen? Packs a delicious delicate flavor that's truly accentuated by that amazing broth.  I could eat ramen everyday and I might have just found my new obsession...

It was 9 o'clock and my boyfriend and I decided to go get tsukemen. Side story: I've been trying to find a good tsukemen place ever since I've tried the best tsukemen place back home on Hawaii. I've been craving it and good tsukemen is hard to find. Tsukemen is basically a dish that you dip noodles in thick tasty broth. Its really delicious. Back to the review: we came to ramen tatsu and the restaurant was 3/4 full of people. We waited a couple minutes and were seated. There was only one server but I have to say, she was on it. We ordered and it only took 5 minutes to get our food. It was very tasty and the portions given was a good amount. I only ate half and packed a to go container for home. I would definitely recommend people to try it if your looking for a different style of ramen!

The tonkotsu broth is amazing here, not too fatty and just the right flavor. In my opinion, flavorful and less fattier than Monta Ramen (even though I like Monta too).

The extra spicy is all overwhelming, it might just start a fire in the hole and the toilet will be your best friend. But def worth it!

I am literally addicted to this place! This is the only ramen i will swear by! Iv been coming here for years now and its my favourite place to eat. Its a small quaint place with very friendly staff, they have a variety of different ramen all with a unique flavour. The spicy ramen is what first turned me to this place but now the shoyu is my absolute fave! Nothing can compare with this restaurant, you will not be disappointed!

Not a long wait like monta!!

My friend and i decided to check out a ramen place we havent gone to in vegas before heading home.

This place didnt have a wait and we were seated right away. 

Their menu is pretty simple-  ramen choices, some appetizers and rice plates.

The 3 stars is purely for the one of the better curry's i've had. The curry almost reminds me of this meat sauce but curry flavored! They have ground meat in the curry that adds more texture and flavor to the rice plate. 

The ramens were so-so. Soup base is definitely better at monta imo, but if you're hungry and hungover for some soup and dont want to tolerate the long wait at monta, this place might be a good idea.

We ordered Tonkatsu, Deluxe Bowl, and Karage.. and wish we couldve ordered many more. The pork is ok,  but the shoyu ramen is to die for! The price is very acceptable and portion is on the generous side. 

RT is becoming a must stop for us whenever we are in town.

Came here last night as I wanted some comfort food after a long day at work. I would usually go to Ramen Kobo because it's only 5-7 minutes away, but I figured I should try out some new ramen places. 

I got the shoyu ramen. The broth is a mix of chicken and pork with a little soy sauce. Toppings are half an egg and green onions, along with 2 pieces of pork. First off, I kinda liked the broth. For some reason, I felt like it's similar to a type of Korean soup base, which I bought from Greenland (I don't know how to say it, its all in Korean characters). The noodles were just okay. I traded off egg with my husband's kikurage (wood ear). He didn't like the kikurage at all, I guess it's an Asian thing. Wood ear was the same everywhere. The meat wasn't as tender as I expected. 

Service was good. There was only one waitress while we were there but it wasn't crowded. We didn't have to wait long, not sure how it comes out when it's real lunch/dinner hours.

A co-worker of mine looked at me and said that he felt a cold coming on. I knew I had the perfect treatment. Ramen Tatsu for lunch, specifically the spicy miso ramen for him. 

We went to one of  my favorite ramen spots. In my opinion this is some of the best Ramen you can find here in Las Vegas. This hidden gem is a small shop nestled between two other shops. 

We were greeted by a smile by the super friendly server we were used to seeing. "Sit anywhere you'd like" she said with a BIG smile. 

We sat at a table where she promptly took our drink orders. We ordered the spicy miso ramen, miso ramen, a large fried rice minus the pork, and a house salad. 

As always, the food did not disappoint. If I could buy a bottle of the dressing they use on their house salad I would. The spicy miso ramen had my co worker sweating it out while I enjoyed my pork free fried rice and salad. Everything was so full of flavor. 

The service here is always perfect. Lots of smiles, very attentive, and the food is always served quickly. 

I highly recommend this ramen shop.

Was lucky enough to try this gem on their opening day.  By far the best Ramen I have had to date and the staff is great.  Very clean and ramen is always delicious.  I sometimes even order extra noodles because I just can't get enough.
The chasiu is incredible! The broth is incredible! Even the gyoza was honestly the best I've had! Time to head home back to the OC...

Oh.... my.... GOSH! This place has the best ramen I have ever had (tastes like ramen i've had in Cali but almost better)! We use to go to Bachi Burger for their ramen, but they stopped serving ramen. Decided to check this place out because of the pics and reviews. My family absolutely loved it! We ordered the Miso Ramen, Spicy Miso Ramen, and Deluxe Ramen. The broth wasn't salty and was very tasty (we all finished eating the broth it was so good), the pork was delicious and almost melted in your mouth, and the staff is very friendly and made us feel welcomed! This will now be our go to place whenever we're in vegas. Seriously, if you want some good ramen you need to check this place out!

Highly recommended go to Ramen place! Super tasty miso broth with awesome pork that melts in your mouth almost like butter! Takoyaki is a delight! 

It's a busy plaza and parking space sucks but we will definitely come back.

I ordered the tsukemen and while the broth had a nice, interesting flavor, it was completely undermined by my ice cold noodles. After 2 minutes my broth became cold as well. Sort of a disappointing experience. If you learn from my mistake I think you might like it. The service was decent. I'll try it again next time I'm in town.

So this is my favorite ramen place in vegas. A lot of people say that sora or monta is better but I can't really compare them (since, I never ate there). However, I don't ever want to put in the effort to go to sora or monta because the wait is aways super long. When, I can just go to Ramen Tatsu, for what I think is the BEST ramen place. 

Not only do they have excellent ramen that taste amazing and balanced but they have curry, that tastes like its from the gods. They even have a ramen that mixes the curry with shoyu and it tastes so good. My dad says that the taste reminds him of when he was in Japan. The taste is very authentic and they are always so fast. 

The ambience of the place is wonderful because it really is like you are in a ramen shop in japan. It's small but by far my favorite place to get ramen, curry, and takoyaki.

We came here because Tatsu was recommended by our friend and also because they have takoyaki on the menu, which I've been craving ever since I've been to Japan. My husband ordered the Deluxe ramen which is humongous, you better be really hungry. It has a tonkotsu - shoyu broth and is loaded with lots of veggies. I ordered the Spicy tonkotsu ramen which has a habanero spice. It had a really good flavor but not spicy at all to me though, so I'd probably get extra spicy next time. I asked them for thick noodles instead of the thin ones it normally comes with which I liked. The Chasiu meat is so soft and tender, melts in your mouth and is one of my favorite chasiu in town. They also have happy hour prices for appetizers from 3-6pm. The Gyoza was good but the takoyaki was blah. I couldn't even taste or see any octopus meat in it. Other than that the ramen was very delicious and our server was cheerful and friendly.

The reviews have been confirmed and are spot on. We had the Miso and Spicy Miso with a side of Gyoza. All delicious, reasonably priced, and satisfying. The soup ranks among the best we've had and worth the trip past the strip. The sign is hard to read from the street but don't worry it's there on the back side of the parking lot. This is not the other Japanese restaurant in the same mall. Besides the food, the place is very clean and cozy. The sound of jazzy covers of pop music wasn't expected but is relaxing and a nice twist to what would normally be an immersive Japanese experience. We likelike a lot.

Trying this place for the first time!! My wife had a taste for Ramen!! Checked yelp real quick and this one had high marks so why not. The staff is very friendly and the service was quick. We're vegetarian and needed to find a broth that wasn't made with a meat base. We ordered The Veggie Ramon with mushroom, corn, bean sprout, green onion and we added cabbage. You can dial up the spice. I'm a wimp so mine was zero and my wife was medium. First bite.... really tasty!! The combination of flavored blend very well! Spicy update!! My wife said Number 4 spice level is Spivey but also damn good!! (She's sucking in air as I type this)  overall great place to eat!!
I know, I know, it's my second review. I love how their is never a wait time. Great apot
Good service. Good food. Love their happy hour menu. This is place is better than Monta, but not sure why it's less busy.
Delicious, the spicy miso was very spicy but very flavorful. This place is just great for Ramen. Highly recommend it!

This is a hidden, little but good ramen spot with a happy hour!

As recommended by my sister and friends I ordered the Curry Ramen and was not let down. I tried what they ordered (number 1 and 3) and enjoyed it as well but the Curry Ramen was deliciously flavor-full and filling! The portion was very large and I had some for take out.

*The had good appetizer deals on their happy hour menu*

Great ramen at the end of a long road trip on a chilly night. Did not try any others in the area but  something of a ramen fiend in NYC and southern California. Thus compares just fine to both in terms of the broth, yum! I like the noodles that came with my spicy tonkatsu just fine, but not a fan of the noodles that came with the plain tonkatsu. Service was very good.

With so many choices it hard to find a good place to eat in Las Vegas, the atmosphere is great not to big and not to small. The staff was friendly and a great clean environment with great services and food makes it a for sure stop on my lunch break!

So far, the tastiest ramen I've had in Vegas.  Compared to Monta and Sora, I feel like their broth isn't as salty which I enjoyed. I tried the miso ramen which had plenty of flavor. The waitress was so genuinely friendly and smiley which I always appreciate. The interior is really clean and the cover music is real mellow. Great spot for quick ramen. Will be back again!
I just want to add that they also have really good curry.  Wasn't expecting the quality from a ramen place.

Great food and great service! I'm not much of a ramen person but decided to try their miso ramen based on the reviews. It was pretty good, but I prefer something spicier. My husband and I also tried their chahan and karage. A little too oily for my taste but again still delicious. Will definitely come back and try other dishes.

So, I was a bit depressed that Tonkatsu Kiyoshi is not open on Sunday.  After filling up the gullet at HK Star on Mothers Day, I wanted to get some tonkatsu for the mother in laws to have at her place for dinner.  So I was calling in an order and realized that they were closed on Sundays.

As I was planning to pick up some to go items from Asian BBQ and Noodles, I saw that Ramen Tatsu sign advertising tonkatsu so I decided to give this place a shot:

a.  Where is everyone?  On a prime mothers day Sunday at lunch, the place had, three people.  

b.  Take out - I was ordering take out, so I decided to forego any noodles and went for tonkatsu, tonkatsu with curry and an order of fried rice.

- Fried Rice - Very tasty, a nice firm consistency with great taste and plenty of small bits of meat.  I enjoyed this very much.  Not sure what was all in it as I just ate it all .  Yeah, I did give some to the mother in law, but took some home too.....

- Tonkatsu with Curry - Since this was take away, the tonkatsu was packed separately of the curry.  The tonkatsu was decent, no real wow factor for me, yet it was very edible.  Just not memorable.  the curry is pretty tasty. I like the dark color and the richness of the curry.  There was no veggies in it like carrots or potatoes to give the curry a bit of flavor and excitement.  It was just curry.

The food as I said was decent, just not anything memorable. The packaging of the take out was good, separating the curry from everything, but the presentation inside the boxes were a bit minimal.  In fact, if anything, the servings were a bit on the small side.

The service is five star!  The waitress was very pleasant and gave me a glass of water while I waited.   I definitely will be coming back soon to try their ramen and other dishes. I like the fact that it is not too busy but I am bit concerned that they are not too busy either.

GK says try this place out, it is authentic and dry nice.  I just have to try a bit more of the food to tie this a 4 star or more...
try their ramen, it is descent, the broth needs more flavors, place is cute, service is on par

I have been craving their tsukemen.  I have been to Monta and Sora in the last 4 weeks and I needed something different.  When I went there about a month ago, it was closed for renovation of some sort.  As it just opened not very long ago, I'm not sure what they needed to do.  

When I arrived today, it didn't look much different at all, so I'm not sure why they've been closed, but anyway, I was stunned to find out that tsukemen has been eliminated from the menu.  As I believe that Monta and Fukumi are the places to go for tonkotsu, sora for miso, and tatsu for tsukemen, it was quite disappointing.  

Anyway, I had tonkotsu as I just had monta last week and wanted to compare the two.  

Let me just say that their ramen is good, but it's not the TYPE of tonkotsu that I like.  If you like shinsengumi in L.A., you will like their version of tonkotsu, but I personally favor more thicker, heavy tonkotsu flavor that you see in Monta or Daikokuya.  

You do see variation in the tonkotsu flavor in Japan, and I'm not going to say that one is better than the other, but it comes down more to personal preference and this isn't the type of tonkotsu that I like, hence I'd say 3.5 stars.  

I wonder if there wasn't enough demand for tsukemen to keep it on the menu?  but it is certainly a disappointment for me.

I was visiting family in Nevada for a week and only had time for one ramen place, so I went here.  I was not disappointed.

I was stationed in Japan with the Navy for a year, so the ramen shops there are the standard on which I base all ramen places.  Ramen Tatsu might as well have been airlifted from Japan and deposited in Las Vegas.  I had the spicy tonkatsu - amazing!  Just the right amount of spiciness so that your nose runs a little, and the perfect tonkatsu flavor.  They also have Asahi on draft, which paired well with the ramen.

If I'm ever back in Vegas, I'll be back at Ramen Tatsu.

Like others, I found this place on semi-accident.  Didn't want to wait at Monta, realized this place was close, etc and so on.  This is now my go-to ramen place in town.  Great food, quick service, really affordable.  Really can't say a bad word about the place.
Our new fav ramen place, definitely coming back here if we visit Vegas again. They have a small portion menu for the kids. Their broth & noddle is bomb!
Great Ramen place, 5 stars all day great service & food! Food came out quickly and hot.

I'm a Monta girl, through and through. That said, what I'm about to share with you will blow your mind. I was in town and my buddy suggested we grab some ramen. I naturally suggested Monta and she countered with Tatsu, and I'm so glad she did. I got the Miso ramen and it was so flavorful and delicious that I damn near cried. Gyoza was amazing as well. Emi, our server, was so nice and even explained the origins of the really neat tiny houses around the restaurant. This place is so good it almost makes me regret moving to California. If you're craving tasty ramen and superior service, give this place a try as you won't be disappointed!!

Loved this place. Ambiance great. Mama San so friendly   Prices reasonable. Ramen so delicious and gyoza was tops!  

Happy hour prices which start at 3 great!

I've been to ramen tatsu twice now and I've enjoyed both visits. The most recent visit I got the tonkatsu ramen. I love that this place is still not super popular so there's never really a wait. The ramen here is also very well priced. 

The tonkatsu ramen had a creamy rich broth. It comes with thin noodles which I like but you can choose your noodle option. The noodles were soft but still had a good bite to it. The ramen comes with woodear mushrooms, charsu pork slices, which melted in your mouth, and green onions. I didn't care for the mushroom. It was super crunchy and flavorless. I would have rather had bean sprouts or bamboo shoots. My friend got the spicy tonkatsu ramen. The soup definitely had a kick. I liked the flavor better but eating the whole bowl would have been a little spicy for me. 

My other friend ordered the spicy miso ramen. The miso flavor is potent in a good way. The next time I go back I'll order that.

Everyone MUST TRY this place! I ordered the deluxe ramen bowl and it was delicious. The chasiu meats were soft and had a little fat in it to add to the taste, unlike Monta where they were too fatty for my preference. Also I was suprised with their homemade gyoza, it was very soft and tender; the crust was thiner than most of the other shop. 

If you like authentic Japanese ramen, you definitely give it a try!!!!!

Monta Ramen used to be my go-to location for ramen in Vegas, but it's now Ramen Tatsu. I'm a bit of a ramen "snob" and have to admit I was very impressed by the flavor of the dashi and the noodle quality.

I will definitely be going back here whenever I'm in Vegas!

With all of the ramen there is in Chinatown now--it's hard to really find some good joints. 

This place was pretty good. We wanted to find a new ramen place other than the usual spots.

It was pretty hoppin' for a Sunday early dinner. Which is always a good sign. 
They have great prices and a pretty good selection of ramen. 
I, myself, always love Miso broth. So I got the Miso Ramen and had them add an egg. It was really good. The broth was excellent. 
They weren't my favorite noodles. They weren't as thick as I was hoping or as firm. Not perverted. Also, the pork here isn't the most tender. I love my pork in ramen to be very tender to where it falls apart easily. Otherwise, your face is over your ramen bowl and you're trying to tear it to peices without making a mess. Or you have to stuff the entire peice in your mouth and look like an idiot while you're eating...or you just look savage as fuck.
So, depending on how you like your ramen--it will determine your experience, of course. 

And I must say, the service here was excellent. All of the staff were very friendly and very upbeat. Our waitress was super happy and literally sang to us the names of what she was serving us. It made all of us laugh and enjoy our dinner much more. That's one thing that we don't see at the other ramen joints. Most of them are "get in and get out". 

Overall, this place was pretty good. I'll definitely go back to try some other type of ramen.

I really like it here. The food and service is consistently good. I always order miso ramen and add egg and seaweed. It is perfect portion and reasonably priced. The servers are all so nice and even though it is a fast pace place, I never feel rushed or unwelcomed. My husband always orders the deluxe ramen with the spicy miso broth. He is always sweating from the spice, but he gets it everytime so it must taste good regardless, HAHAH.
Excellent service, excellent ramen! This is my first time here but I will definitely return.
Best ramen in town!!! I have tried all the ramen places in town and most if not all the ramen places are way too salty. Service is always friendly.

Can I just say that this place is simply AMAZING! Why? Because we were greeted by the one and only server there who seated us as well, took our orders, and refilled our drinks without us ever asking for it. Oh and by the way it was a full house! She was so cheerful and sweet I loved it! By far the best ramen place I've been to. It was amazingly delicious and the price was definitely worth every cent! I couldn't have been more satisfied. We also ordered the kimchi fried rice. We will be coming back here I'm so glad I found this hidden joint. Just worth it!

By far the best ramen in town!
Silky delicious broth with perfectly textured noodles!
I've had the miso, shoyu, and the tonkatsu, all are delicious. 
Service is always outstanding!

The ramen was cooked perfectly. I ordered the curry ramen and the broth wasn't watered down, I'd even wager to say it was a little rich for my taste. Overall, nearly perfect ramen.

The service here was the main selling point. Our server was quirky, friendly, and in general seemed happy to be there. Of course this was during the non-busy hours, so that could change.

Overall it was delicious ramen with great service. The place isn't fancy but it did feel welcoming, so take that for how you will.

Also the portion sizes were good. My friend got a deluxe ramen and it was massive.
I love it not only because of the food but it was so kid friendly we will be coming back for sure

It's a decent get by place. I was fairly disappointed my most recent visit though. The chasiu was pretty much straight fat, little to none of it was meat.  I also got the takoyaki and that was completely disappointing. Takoyaki is octopus balls. The tako was nonexistent.

This place is becoming popular! Came here today when Ramen Sora had a long line and we arrived just in time. The ramen is very good here, I would definitely recommend just as good as Sora and better than Monta!!
I love ramen bars and this place is fantastic the Mochi ice cream is delicious and the ramen is just perfect anytime I come to Vegas I gotta come here

The decor was nice n modern,place was not busy at all....only had one customer other than my hub n I....we came on Friday  lunch time around noon. Service was good. But was very disappointed in the ramen....taste of broth was just ok..I ...nothing special. I ordered spicy miso n my hub ordered the reg miso ramen.
Spicy  Miso ramen only came w/ small bits of meat n green onions.... Where is the charsu? Most places already includes couple peices of charsu and other veg....I didn't realize I had to order on side.... Anyway, i think I will try other ramen places before coming back.

Consistently fantastic! Been here probably once a week for the last year. Even at peak times I've never had to wait longer than 15 minutes for a table. Service is always warm and efficient. I haven't settled on a favorite ramen because I like them all. Most often I get the Tonkotsu Shoyu with spicy bean sprouts and an egg. It's rich, filling and delicious. Would recommend a hundred times over.

There's so many ramen restaurants in town and this is one of my fav, indeed this is my fav! 

Spicy miso & tonkotsu shoyu are my favorites.  Lately my hubby is addicted to spicy tonkotsu ramen as well.  All the ramen tasted delish, the broth was rich but not too salty, the ramen was al dente.  Yum! 

I love their takoyaki, it's lightly crunch and crispy. Texture was amazing!

The seating there is very comfy and inviting, very authentic Japanese style, parking usually is easy.  

I like the other ramen places too but most of them have a hectic parking situation or the line is ridiculously long.  

They have happy hours during the weekday, 3-6pm, almost half price on the alcohol & most appetizers.  Love it!
A good selection of ramen and appetizers. Very tasty cold noodles in case its over 100 degrees outside!
Bun and I got upset tummy's after our 2nd time going...immediately after coming home and eating this for dinner

Great reviews on Yelp so I went here since it's open until 11pm. I got seated right away, they do have few bar seating and half dozen tables, it's quite a small shop. The food came out pretty quick like a typical ramen shop. Not quite a open kitchen either like most ramen shops. 

I ordered the tonkatsu shoyu ramen, the flavor was pretty good not as rich broth as I have had at other places. My only problem was their food was on the salty side. If it was lighter it would have been better and I would have rated them higher, also the noodles were also to Al dente for my taste. I felt the noodles should have been softer, need a few more minutes of cooking time. The pork slices on top of the noodles also was a bit salty. I also ordered a pork belly rice bowl but that too was salty.

It was decent but due to the improperly cooked noodles and saltyness not my favorite.
Very cute cozy  place.. food is amazing  and very authentic.. service is great and super friendly.

Normally I wouldn't eat ramen when it's 105 degrees outside but I let the kids pick! This cozy little restaurant has some friendly staff and fast service. We happened to go during happy hour so we ordered the edamame and takoyaki off the hh menu. Nothing disappointed! The takoyaki was soft and gooey with a tender chunk of octopus inside. The ramen was flavored generously but not too much. I hate when ramen is too salty and the broth here was well balanced. I'd definitely return when in need of hot noodles!

I knew something was weird when you can walk in without queuing up on a Friday night. Wife ordered the deluxe & I had the miso. That night after dinner, she almost died from food poison. I think something went very bad, could have been the pork broth. Be weary. Friday night dinner turned into Friday night restroom massacre. Something could have been left out. It's 4am and my stomach is still rumbling.

10am next day - my wife is still going..

Shame.


Shame.

Shame.
Ramen Tatsu is a small japfood joint. I went there primarily because of the reviews. It did not disappoint at all. Quality is superb. Price is fantastic. Good for family with children.

This is a great ramen place. We enjoyed the food and service very much. We were a bit early evening by design, about 4:45pm beats the crowds, and we found there was a happy hour menu, 4-6pm.

We were hungry and picked a few things from the menu as well as the happy hour menu, can't resist $3 Asahi! We also ended up with edamame, goyza, chicken katsu curry, the deluxe ramen and the shoyu ramen, all very good. 

I'm still tasting the curry and will want to come back for the curry ramen! All very good, food, good service, enjoyed the 'blues' background music and of course my husband as company! 

Will keep this place on the list for the wintery cold nights when a bit of warm soup will go far to hit the spot!

Our new go to ramen spot here in Vegas and we've been to them all. Not to say that others are junk but this one is now our favorite. It's a little small, but all the best places are. 
 
We are what's scientifically known as fatasses and you'll soon see why.  Keep in mind, the following was only for me and my 5 foot girlfriend. We started with the gyoza and it was seriously good. My gf ate almost all of them and she usually only eats one or two pieces. Then we had an egg with ground pork bowl, which was also very tasty, kinda like shin sen gumi in LA. We also got the small curry bowl (because I love curry) and it was on point! I would come here for just the curry, even though I would have to order a ramen just because my stomach is built that way. 

Those were just the appetizers. Which we demolished. Then we got our ramen. I believe she had the shoyu ramen which I didn't really get to taste, well, because she ate it all. I got the tonkatsu shoyu ramen. I really liked it because usually the tonkatsu broths are a little on the heavy side but this one was flavorful and light. I would like to say we took some home, but no. We finished everything. 

So anyways, we got dessert. Not just a little. We didn't save room for it at all, we just kinda stuffed it in there. We got the Vanilla mochi ice cream. This was only ok. My gf didn't like the skin because it was kind of hard. But we got the mango cheesecake and that was good! It was super creamy. So creamy in fact in inspired me to get the New York style as well. This one was eh.. Only ok too. It was hard and not as creamy. Or maybe it was too cold, probably because we got it after they already closed. 

This is definitely the spot to go if you're craving a ramen fix.

I really like this place.  Its busy without being crowded and the service is attentive and not overwhelming.  I've tried every broth and they are all great.  The toppings are very fresh and generous.  I prefer this to monta.  The quality is always consistent and the atmosphere is not pretentious and very welcoming.

MY NUMBER ONE RAMEN SPOT. I cant explain it but it just hits the spot EVERY TIME. Its cozy and the quality is consistent everytime. I bring my friends and family here. Happy hour is 3-7pm and you'll usually find me here around that time. I want their summer special again.

First time here and I decided to try the Deluxe Tonkatsu ramen. It was a big bowl with plenty of spread; omg the pork was so tender and delicious. The noodles were almost perfect. I was, however, looking for more seasoning in their broth but it was still close to amazing. 

Also, I tried the curry. The taste reminded me of childhood memories but I was quite disappointed that there were no potatoes, carrots or anything in the curry itself. Not even a piece of chicken. It could have been much better. 

Outside of the restaurant, parking absolutely sucks. It is in a location with tons of restaurants and shops and it's hard to find parking during peak hours.  

This was my first ramen experience in Vegas. It wasn't a bad one. And it wasn't great. But it sure isnt the last. The quest continues.

I had high hopes for this place....but I left slightly disappointed.  We'll start with the good, the decor is simple with clean lines and they have a few items that I will be looking forward to in the future, such as karaage and takoyaki!  I love takoyaki, so if they get that going and it tastes good, I might just stop by for that by itself and a char siu bowl.  Now for the not so good, I tried the Tatsu Ramen which has a tonkatsu broth with 5-6 pieces of char siu and a piece of seaweed.  I felt everything was a little bland and under seasoned.  The soup base tasted slightly watery and could have used just a pinch of salt to bring the flavor out a little better.  I think this was a general consensus, since I heard the elderly couple next to us actually tell the waiter that they felt their Miso Ramen needed salt.  The pork belly was thicker cut, similar to Ramen Sora, but marbled in fat like Monta's.  However, again the pork lacked seasoning.  They also put the ginger in the bowl for you, instead of having on the side...which i dislike since ginger is pretty overpowering and a personal preference.  They also have the option of two different types of noodles, thick and thin.....I ordered the thick noodles and felt they were a little soggy already by the time I started eating....So unfortunately at this point, I will be returning to my old stomping grounds of Monta and Ramen Sora.
Favorite ramen joint in town. I'm there about once a week. Try the tsukemen, my favorite, but all the different types are delicious. Great service and prices.

I was excited to have some ramen in Vegas but I was disappointed in this spot. My ramen came out and it looked like it was missing some more broth. I understand that there's an option to purchase more broth but I didn't even have enough broth to warm up both of my COLD chasu or egg. Chasu was good and tender but they sliced it thinly AND gave only 2 pieces in my miso ramen. The egg was not really as flavorful in comparison to other places. On a good note, my thick ramen noodles were good and the texture was just right. Service was good just the food wasn't as good as I had hoped for.

The tsukemen noodle was too fishy for my liking. I know the original tsukemen noodles from Japan are fishy but I can't be too angry considering on the menu it did say fish broth. I prefer my tuskemen noodles with a perfect balance of sweet, fishy, brothy but possibly other people may like the super Fishy taste. I know from experience that tsukemen is different for everyone so that is why I am not giving them a 1 star review. Service was good from this place.

I hate being a hater but that was a 2 star experience.  They can't compete with the big boys down the street.  

My wife got the tonkotsu ramen and while the broth was decent, they gave her thin noodles which she didn't like at all.  The server didn't even offer a choice and the thick noodles in my deluxe were way better.  The deluxe definitely wasn't skimpy on ingredients but the broth was bland and the charsiu was just OK.  I would have ordered the deluxe with tonkotsu ramen or shoyu (soy sauce) if I could do it again.  

What's up with no music in the restaurant?  I felt like I was eating ramen in a library.

Is 3 stars the new 2 stars?  Even the 3 star reviews are telling readers to go elsewhere.
I love this place! The tonkotsu shoyu ramen is damn good! The service is awesome and quick! I go here everytime I want ramen! Must go!

So much better and shorter line than Monta Ramen.  We came here with a group of 4 on a Saturday night and got seated immediately.  Service was fast as well.  We all ordered the new ramen they had, the Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen, but I added garlic chips and egg.  Garlic chips were good but a little to potent for me.  You can't go wrong with adding egg to ramen.  We also order the takoyaki and karaage.  Karaage is a must try, though their portion is a little small, not bad for the price though, about $4.25.  Parking can be a problem since there are so many other stores within the plaza.

Service, service, service!  We came in during happy hour and most of the side items were reduced.  It was all very tasty and delicious.  The ramen was fantastic.  Had the spicy ramen and it has enough spice and flavor.  It wasn't salty at all.  Will be back next time in town.

I read about Ramen Tatsu in today's Review Journal, in Wednesday's "Taste" section. I'd been craving some authentic Japanese ramen for a few days, so Mark and I thought we'd give it a try. I was really looking forward to the tonkotsu ramen. Tonkotsu is a pork based broth that is very time-consuming to make; the southern Japanese island of Kyushu is probably the capital of tonkotsu ramen, and I've had the real thing many times.

Chef Wayne Kageyama's tonkotsu did not disappoint; it was not as rich as the shiru (soup) that I became accustomed to in Fukuoka, and it had a decidedly smoky flavor that I didn't expect but was most pleasantly surprised by. The tonkotsu ramen was the only menu choice to offer the thin noodles that I prefer, and the smokiness of the broth was an excellent foil for the kimchi that I ordered extra as a topping. The very generous portion quite sated me; I had no reason or desire to order extra noodles or soup.

Mark ordered the shoyu ramen, which came with the thick noodles. The garlic chips that he ordered were a little overpowering, but the broth was delicate and not too salty at all.

We ordered a side of gyoza (better known to Americans as "pot stickers") and a side of takoyaki - small dough balls filled with pieces of octopus and topped, usually, with a sweet teriyaki type sauce, Japanese mayonnaise and shredded or powdered nori. 

The gyoza were delightful; well-stuffed, fried perfectly and then quickly steamed in the pan to offer a contrast of crunch and chew. They brought back fond memories of sake-soaked late nights in mom-and-pop shops that abound in the back alleys of Osaka, trying to stave off the next morning's inevitable hangover, heh heh. 

Osaka is famous for takoyaki, and unfortunately I found Tatsu's to be a small disappointment in an otherwise exceptional and very authentic meal. There was not enough octopus, and the the sauce that topped them off was almost sweet enough to make them a dessert. I must admit though, I did eat all of them!

I highly recommend this comfortable and clean restaurant for an authentic and reasonably priced adventure into Japanese cuisine. Chef Kageyama is very affable; the staff, who are all Japanese, are pleasant and efficient, and more than willing to overlook the errors in my Japanese, which has become a bit rusty of late.

The restaurant is located in a strip mall on the east side of South Jones, between Spring Mountain and Desert Inn; parking is not a problem. Beer (served ice-cold), wine, and hot and cold sake are available. Major credit cards are accepted. Dessert is conspicuously absent from the menu, but there IS a Baskin-Robbins right across the street, should you feel the need for something sweet afterward. If this review convinces you to try Ramen Tatsu out, please give a "hello" to chef Kageyama from me -the "gaijin" from Osaka!

It's been a long time since I've tried a new ramen place. Jinya and Sora are my usual to go's for ramen. But I wanted to try somewhere new and promote our ramen culture ! Coming into this small corner shop that is in a busting popular shopping center from the cold was a delight. The shop is full of homely decor, and while we visited full of Christmas knicknacks. The staff were kind and sweet, making sure we were comfortable. Even though it was just my boyfriend and I the insisted we switched to a larger table to more comfortable. So sweet ! Once we got our menus we were drooling! Not only did everything look good but it was bang for your buck! Usually, Sora is my top choice for cheaper ramen but these prices blew it out of the water. Not only that but once we ordered our ramens, I the Shio and my bf the Tonkotsu Shoyu we were amazed. These blew Sora's out of water for us. Their eggs were much better seasoned, a big swing for us. Their broth was incredibly more flavorful. We also got some gyoza, another favorite of ours. It was very tasty, the searing making it just the perfect type of crispy. It was a bit too garlicy for me but I overall enjoyed the appetizer. This place surely will be our spot for cheap ramen and trust me the taste will not be cheap at all!
Great noodle house! Came here with my wife friday @11:30 , pretty quiet and the service was great! The noodle bowls are pretty good. Price was cheap!

Best ramen I've had in Vegas! The pork belly literally melts in your mouth like butter the noodles perfectly cooked and the broth mmmmm I can drink it by itself. We got the deluxe ramen, gyoza, karrage chicken everything was delicious service was great my only complaint would be to have more drinking choices like lemonade or juices I like to treat myself when I go out but I can't have soda.

Went on Tuesday 7-5-16 around 8PM for a late dinner. This restaurant is located on Jones between Desert Inn & Spring Mountain.  $18.47 got me a shio ramen bowl, a small order of fried rice, an oolong tea, and an order of edamame.  

$7.77 shio ramen- The noodles were nice and thick and at first I thought the broth was kinda bland but after adding some shichimi it was perfect.  I added an egg for an extra dollar.  The portion size was larger than I expected for the price.  A very good value!  The chasu is kind of thin however and not as tender as Sora's version.  

Their fried rice is a steal for $3.77...absolutely delicious and I'm craving it again already!  I also enjoyed their edamame which was served hot and salty in an adorable bowl which also held the shells.  

The server could not have been nicer.  She was absolutely bending over backwards to make us happy!  This place is a great value for the money and I really enjoyed coming here.

I've been to the 4 or 5 ramen joints on Spring Mountain and I've found my favorite with Tatsu.

There's a great selection of bowls: Shoyu, Shio, Miso, Tonkotsu, Curry, and others. When there's a wide selection like this, I find usually there is a loss in quality - as if having only two or three bowls like other ramen spots allows them to output great flavor in a speedy service. At Tatsu, you get the complete package: quick service and high quality flavor in each bowl; each distinct and unique from the next. 

By now, I've tried them all (they now also have customizable options for additional ingredients). Over the months that I've been coming in here, I've noticed I'm not the only one that prefers Tatsu.  Business is doing well - more tables have been set in place, two flat screens were installed, and the menu has expanded. 

This summer, they introduced Cold Ramen - a different delicious take on ramen for a hot day - and also Tsukemen which has thicker noodles with a dipping sauce of a hint of fish flavor.

I keep coming back because it's the best and the entire menu is top notch. I wouldn't be surprised if this hidden gem gets more and more popular in the near future.
